loans.name: Charles

texts.es:
Charles tiene 31 años, es un buen hombre, muy amable y amante de la naturaleza. Su pareja es Beydi, de 27 años, con quien tiene una niña de 5 años que tiene como nombre Claribel.
Durante su vida Charles realizó múltiples trabajo, pero el que más le llenó de satisfacciones es la reforestación, debido a que le gusta la naturaleza y tiene como fin ayudar a que se mantenga viva. A diario realiza reforestación de plantas y árboles de todo tipo de especie. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años y se siente muy contento de contribuir con un granito de arena a la conservación del medio ambiente.
Le está yendo bien, ya que gracias a su trabajo ha sensibilizado a gran parte de la población, quienes entienden con sus charlas que es de mucha importancia contribuir a la conservación del medio ambiente. Espera seguir trabajando, para lograr que el planeta siga respirando y dándonos oxígeno limpio.

Este será su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, y así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará los herramientas que necesita para continuar con su trabajo; además de algunos plantones que necesita para seguir brindando sus servicios.
texts.en:
Charles is 31 years old and is a good, friendly man who loves nature.  His wife, Beydi is 27 years old and they have a five year old daughter named Claribel.

Throughout his life Charles has done many kinds of work, but what satisfies him the most is reforestation because he likes nature and he wants to keep it alive.  He works each day replanting trees and plants of all species.  He has been doing this kind of work for two years and he is very happy to be able to help the environment a tiny bit.

Things are going well for him and thanks to his work he has sensitized a large part of the population who understand, because of his chats with them, that is it’s important to contribute to the conservation of the environment.  He hopes to continue working so that the planet can continue to breathe and provide us with clean oxygen.

This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support and he feels certain to move ahead with his business.  He is also committed to making his payments.  He is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of its members are very responsible and united.

With the requested amount of 1,000 PEN, he will buy the tools he needs to continue his work, as well as some seedlings he needs to continue providing his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and seedlings

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel tiene 47 años, está casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Estela, con quien vive en la ciudad de Encarnación. El señor Daniel es comerciante, tiene un pequeño local en la ciudad de Encarnación en donde vende prendas de vestir, remedios naturales y otros artículos, su esposa también le ayuda en su negocio, cuando el no puede ir. Gracias a esto ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar, ya que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedican al comercio y han ido creciendo poco a poco.
El Daniel ha solicitado este crédito para comprar prendas de vestir para temporada de invierno ya que con eso tendrá mejores productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Señor Daniel is 47 and has been married for a while to Señora Estela, with whom he lives in the city of Encarnación.  Señor Daniel is a merchant, he has a small shop in the city of Encarnación where he sells clothing, natural remedies, and other items.  His wife also helps with the business when he is unable to go.  Thanks to this they have been able to get ahead in life, educate their children, and maintain their home, since they have long made a living through commerce and have been growing little by little.  Daniel has asked for this loan to buy clothing for the winter season because with this he will have better products to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive su casa de la ciudad de Encarnación. El se dedica a la compra - venta y distribución al por mayor y menor de envases de plástico hace mas de 15 años por toda la ciudad.
Comenta que por medio de este trabajo ha podido mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para una buena educación. El lucha diariamente por su familia, ya que ellos son su razón de ser.
Carlos solicita el crédito para la compra de envases de plástico al por mayor y de esa forma obtener una mayor ganancia al comprar en forma mayorista. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is married and has three children. He lives in his own home in the city of Encarnación. Carlos buys, sells, and distributes plastic containers in bulk and in smaller amounts. He has been doing this for more than 15 years and his products are sold throughout the city. Because of his job, Carlos says that he has been able to sustain his family and provide what they need for a good education. He strives every day for his family since they are his reason for living.

Carlos is requesting a loan in order to buy plastic containers in bulk. He will be able to generate more revenue by purchasing wholesale. Carlos appreciates the opportunity he has received because it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers to sell.

loans.name: Mastullah

texts.en:
Mastullah is 44 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. For the past five years, Mastullah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Mastullah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for the restaurant, and will help Mastullah to generate greater profits and grow her business. Mastullah hopes that in the future she will be able to to own a big business. 

Mastullah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mastullah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for her restaurant

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel tiene 33 años de edad se encuentra acompañado con la Sra. Sabina con quien tiene 2 hijos quienes son la razón de lucha de ambos.
El Sr. Daniel se dedica al comercio, vende Cds, Mp3, Mp4 y todo tipo de accesorios para celulares. Tiene un local en el centro de Asunción y también realiza su venta los días domingo y lunes en su moto por la zona donde vive. Es una persona muy responsable y activa. Comenta que se dedica a esta actividad desde más de 9 años y gracias a su sacrificio y perseverancia ha logrado tener una casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de discos y accesorio para celulares, con lo cual podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir dándole variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Daniel is 33 years old. He is married to Sabina, with whom he has two children, who give them both motivation to work hard. Daniel makes a living in sales, selling CDs, Mp3s, Mp4s and all types of accessories for cellular phones. He has a small shop in the city center of Asunción and also makes sales on Sundays and Mondays using his motorcycle to drive around in the area close to his home. He is a very responsible and active person. He has been working in this business for the past 9 years. Thanks to his sacrifice and perseverance he has succeeded in purchasing his own home with all the necessary amenities. He has requested a loan to buy CDs and accessories for cell phones, which will allow him to have a good assortment of products in his business and continue offering variety to his customers.

loans.use: to buy CDs and accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается ремонтом аудиотехники. Сама Гулбахор занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелко – рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is involved in repairing audio equipment.  Gulbahor is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds small livestock for future sale.  She has been in this business for four years.  Gulbahor is requesting this loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Sadiniso

texts.ru: Садинисо жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 55 лет. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Она зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области Садинисо три года. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Sadiniso is a resident of the Qumsangir district.  She is 55 years old, a widow and has four children.  She earns a living by breeding cattle.  Sadiniso has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha is a baker. In this photo, she is standing in front of the oven she uses to bake. She bakes and sells bread, which she has done for 10 years now. She is divorced. Agartha uses her income for the general upkeep of her home. Agartha will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil  for her bakery. With the new profit she will buy a modern oven to make her work easier.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Tajiddin

texts.ru: Восемь лет тому назад добрый и трудолюбивый человек под именем Тачиддин начал свою деятельность в сфере торговли. Он начал свой бизнес с надеждой получения прибыли для  содержания семьи и обучения своих детей. Ранее он был в России на заработках и накопив деньги он начал данный бизнес. Тачиддин заботливый семьянин и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. В основном он занимается купле- продажей парфюмерии и косметики. Его бизнес приносит ему хороший доход и он хочет расширить его и стать успешным бизнесменом. Тачиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки парфюмерии и косметики с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Eight years ago, a kind and hardworking person, named Tajiddin started his business in the retail field.  He began his business with the hope of making enough profit to support his family and educate his children.  He was previously in Russia and started his business after saving money.  Tajiddin is a caring family man, who is raising four children.  He primarily sells perfumes and cosmetics.  His business brings him a good income, and he wants to expand it and become a successful businessman.  Tajiddin wants to obtain this loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics in order to refill his working capital.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics in order to refill his working capital

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар житель города Истаравшан. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он занимается скотоводством. В этом ему помогает его жена. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Dilovar is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  His wife helps him with this business.  Dilovar is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Faiziniso

texts.ru: Файзинисо родилась в 1964 году, она замужем имеет 2 детей.Она занимается торговлей  продуктами питаниия (точнее сахаром,солью,разными крупами).Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 5 лет.Файзинисо сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2007 года.Она очень довольна и благодарна таким организациям за финансовую помощь.На полученный кредит она планирует расширить свой тварооборот, приобрести прдукты питания и увеличить свой капитал на будущее детей.
texts.en: Faiziniso was born in 1964.  She is married and has two children.  She is involved in selling food products (specifically, sugar, salt, various grains).  She has been in this business for five years.  Faiziniso has been partnering with our organization since 2007.  She is very satisfied and grateful to such organizations for the financial help.  She plans to use this loan to increase her product turnover, buy food products and increase her capital for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Mouhamadou

texts.fr: Mouhamadou est un commerçant qui tient une boutique au marché central de sa localité. Il vend des produits et denrées alimentaires.Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses trois enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter du riz, du sucre, des haricots verts et de l'huile. Son ambition est de renforcer d'avantage son stock.
texts.en:
Mouhamadou has a stall at the central market of his neighborhood. He sells foodstuffs, and his business brings in the revenue needed to support his wife and three children. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 150,000F to buy rice, sugar, green beans and oil. His goal is to stock up on merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, green beans and oil for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de la ciudad de Concepcion, vive con su marido don Evelio y 4 de sus hijos por que una de sus hijas esta en el extranjero trabajando. Maria tiene un negocio de recepcion y una pequeña despensa, tanto ella  y su hija Dimia se ayudan en todos los eventos, fiestas y decoraciones, Dimia se encarga de la decoracion y el marido, Don Evelio, se encarga del transporte con su vehiculo, ya que el tiene su carpinteria y permanece mas timpo en ella haciendo su trabajo.
Esta familia es muy trabajadora y sacrificada, todos se ayudan, y agradece a la fundacion por darles la oportunidad de otorgarles un credito ya que con eso desena comprar una maquina de lavar, con lo que podrá lavar mejor los manteles porque es un trabajo muy pesado
texts.en:
Señora Maria is from the city of Concepcion.  She lives with her husband Don Evelio and four of their children, as one of her daughters is working abroad.

Maria has a business doing events and a small store.  Both she and her daughter Dimia help out with all kinds of events, parties and decorations.  Dimia is in charge of the decorations, and Maria's husband, Don Evelio, is in charge of transportation with his vehicle as he has a carpentry workshop and spends a lot of time there doing his work.

This family is very hard-working and self-sacrificing.  They all help each other, and thank the Fundacion for giving them the opportunity by providing them with a loan, as with this loan they plan to purchase a washing machine.  With this they will be able to better wash the tablecloths, as this is very hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor for his rice growing activity.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton tiene 49 años, es un señor muy amable y trabajador. Está separado de su pareja aunque viven en la misma casa con sus dos hijos, pues la vivienda le pertenece a ambos, ya que juntos trabajaron para poder comprarla.

Se dedica a la producción de cítricos y verduras. Tiene una chacra en la cual trabaja por más de 10 años con los cítricos y unos 25 años con las verduras. Trabaja muy bien sus tierras y es por eso que crecen productos grandes y buenos, muy buscados por los compradores en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Le gusta todo de su trabajo, ama estar en el campo, en contacto con la naturaleza, pues creció con este trabajo y sabe mucho de la tierra. Tiene buenos clientes y como saben que tiene un buen producto le pagan el precio que él exige. Además tiene un proyecto que le gustaría cumplir, le encantaría tecnificar sus plantaciones de cítricos, poner un sistema automático de riego y hacer un pozo tubular para que tenga un mejor resultado.

Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometido en pagar, una vez más, las cuotas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómodo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, 4500 soles, preparará su terreno para el invierno con la compra de abono, fertilizante y mano de obra.
texts.en:
Milton, age 49, is a friendly and hardworking gentleman. He is separated from his partner, but they live in the same house with their two children. They both own the house since they had worked together to purchase it.

Milton produces citrus fruits and vegetables. He has a field where he works. Milton has been growing citrus fruits for 10 years and vegetables for about 25 years. He does a very good job of working the land, which is why his products are large and of good quality. Many buyers at the wholesale market in his city look for his products. He greatly enjoys his work because he loves being in the fields and in contact with nature. Milton has good customers who know that he has a high-quality product and are willing to pay what he asks. He also has a project that he would like to complete. Milton would like to mechanize his citrus groves by installing an automatic irrigation system and a tube well for better results.

This is his 10th loan with MFP and Milton hopes to use it to continue with his goals. Once again, he is very committed to submitting his payments on time and in a responsible manner. He is very comfortable with his Communal Bank because his fellow group members are very responsible and always supportive of one another. The loan amount of 4,500 PEN that he requested will be used to prepare his land for the winter by purchasing compost, fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru: Рачаб добрый и трудолюбивый человек и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Его жена занимается домохозяйством. На протяжении 29 лет он занимается предоставлением услуги покраски автомашин и услуг кузовщика. В бизнесе помогают ему его сыновья. Он очень опытный человек в своем деле и имеет много постоянных клиентов, которые ему доверяют. Рачаб хотел бы получить займ для покупки сырья и красок для ремонта автомашин. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajab is a kind and hardworking person, who is raising two children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Rajab has been involved in providing auto paint and repair services for 29 years.  His sons help him with the business.  He is a very experienced person in his business and has many regular customers, who trust him.  Rajab wants to obtain this loan to buy raw materials and paint for car repairs.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and paint for car repairs

loans.name: Kamoljon

texts.ru: Камолчон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Комилчон занимается частным извозом. Он уже три года предоставляет услугу. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Kamoljon lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  Kamoljon is involved in private transportation.  He has been providing this service for three years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene de 41 años, toda su vida demostró ser una mujer muy luchadora, ya que como es madre soltera tuvo que criar a sus dos hijos sola. Ellos tienen 17 y 12 años, y gran parte de lo que han logrado hasta ahora es porque tienen una madre que trabaja para brindarles lo mejor.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral en un espacio amplio que acondicionó en su casa. Cría alrededor de 100 pollos cada vez que inicia una etapa nueva de crianza, llevarlos a la venta le toma un promedio de 45 días. Cuando están listos se va a un mercado céntrico de la ciudad a ofrecerlos, ya que tiene buenos clientes que siempre están a la expectativa de comprarle, debido a que sus pollos son buenos porque los cría con alimentos balanceados. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años y le gusta porque le permite disponer de su tiempo, aunque al principio se enfrentó con muchos problemas, como no saber cómo es el proceso completo de crianza o que tendría que ponerle una vacuna a cada pollo; pero ahora es todo una experta y cada día mejora su manera de criar.

Éste es su préstamo número 15 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, pues se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. También manifiesta estar feliz en este grupo, ya que es una socia muy antigua y enseña a los nuevos cómo trabajar en equipo y a actuar de manera responsable, y todos son así.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará pollos bebés para iniciar con su crianza, además de alimentos balanceados y algunas vitaminas y vacunas necesarias para su buen desarrollo.
texts.en:
Deysi is 41 years old. All of her life, she has demonstrated that she is a very determined woman. As a single mother, she must raise her two children alone. They are 17 and 12 years of age. Most of what they achieved to this point is attributed to having a mother who works in order to provide them the best.

Deysi raises poultry in a large space in her home that is well-suited. She raises approximately 100 chickens at a time, starting at the stage when they are newly hatched. Deysi keeps them for an average of 45 days. When the chickens are ready to be sold, she takes them to the central market in the city. Deysi has good customers who are always expected to buy from her since her chickens are good as a result of being raised on a balanced diet. She has been in this business for six years and enjoys it because it enables her to make use of her time. At first she had many problems, such as not knowing the complete process for raising chickens or that she had to vaccinate each bird. Now she is a total expert and is improving her process each day.

This is her 15th loan with MFP and she is pleased to know that she has financial support. Deysi feels confident that she can advance her business. Once again, just like her previous loans, she promises to complete her payments. Deysi also says that she is happy with her group. She is a long-time member who shows the new members how to work as a team and act in a responsible manner, and everyone does. The loan amount of 1,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy baby chicks that she can begin raising. She will also buy balanced feed, a few vitamins, and necessary vaccines for good development.

loans.use: to buy chickens, balanced feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime compró materiales para su producción, encontró buenos precios en las cuerinas, correderas, hilos y con ello fabricó bolsos y maletines muy bonitos, a precios competitivos y esto fue lo que impactó a su clientela y justamente ocurrió gracias a su credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a un segundo financiamiento, con el cual comprara materiales nuevamente y una maquina industrial, para mejorar los tiempos productivos y dar un mejor acabado a sus productos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Agradecido con todos por esa gran ayuda , mil bendiciones y sigan apoyando a la fuerza productiva en Colombia.”
texts.en:
Jaime purchased materials for his production.  He found good prices on imitation leather, zippers, and thread, and with these he made very attractive bags and briefcases at competitive prices.  This has been what made an impact on his customers, and it happened thanks to his Kiva loan.

Currently he is applying for a second loan, with which he will once more purchase materials and an industrial sewing machine to improve his production times and give his products a better finish.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you to all of you for this great support. A thousand blessings and continue supporting the productiveness of Columbia".

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies to make bags, and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory of hardware items

loans.name: Ledys Tatiana

texts.es: Ledys de 19 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 3 años de edad, en el municipio de Galapa, donde  se dedica al comercio de mercancías que vende mediante guías especializadas  y también tiene otra actividad que aprendió por tradición de su padre, donde fabrica productos de panadería. Su iniciativa empresarial data desde el  año 2011, cuando empezó vendiendo mercancía cosmética y accesorios, mediante guías especializadas.  El negocio de la panaderia lo realiza con ayuda de su padre en horas de la noche cuando este regresa de su trabajo, y los panes y pastelitos los reparte en horas de la mañana en tiendas del barrio donde reside y otros del sectorm, compra las materias primas en una distribuidora del municipio de Galapa.En su otro negocio comercialización de  productos por catalogo, sus facturas las cancela cada 10 dias, y realiza sus ventas  a crédito entre familiares y vecinos del sector donde reside, esta actividad la realiza en el resto del dia. Su inversión será exitosa porque tiene muy buena demanda, debido a la buena calidad de los productos que fabrica y comercializa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, del cual Invertirá el 50% en productos por catálogos y el otro 50%, en materiales para elaborar panes y pastelitos, porque su meta base, es organizar una miscelánea y también tener una panadería bien estructurada y es que  finalmente su sueño es tener su casa propia y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ledys is 19 years old and lives with her spouse and their 3-year-old daughter in the town of Galapa, where she works selling specialized catalog merchandise. She is also in the baking business, which she learned from her father as a family tradition. 
Her business initiative dates back to 2011, which is when she started selling cosmetics and accessories through specialized catalogs.  With her father's help, she works in the baking business during the evening hours, after he gets off work. In the mornings, she delivers their bread and pastries to stores in her neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. She buys the raw material from a distributor in Galapa. She dedicates the rest of her day to her other business, selling products by catalog. She pays invoices every ten days, and sells on credit to relatives and neighbors in the area where she lives.
Her investment will be successful because she has high demand, due to the good quality of the products she makes and sells. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will invest 50% of it in catalog products, and the other 50% in materials to make bread and pastries, because her main goal is setting up a general store and also having a well-structured bakery. Her ultimate dream is to have her own home and provide for her family.

loans.use: to invest in catalog merchandise (50%) and in products to make bread and pastries (50%).

loans.name: Los Picaflores De Los Chacos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS PICAFLORES DE LOS CHACOS está  compuesto por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un  varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carmen tiene 29 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene 3 hijos que son de las edades de  8 años, 4 años y 7 meses de gestación, la Sra. Carmen se dedica a la venta de carne, ella tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, ella vive en la zona 23 de Diciembre, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carmen va a usar este préstamo para compra de un Frízer, esto le permitirá conservar en buen estado la carne que vende,  la Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que el precio de carne aumente y esto hace que la carne escasee, la Sra. Carmen  va a utilizar los beneficios para comprar más carne y así de esta manera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, desea con el tiempo  tener una carnicería equipada, la Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo y a que son en algunos casos personas que sacan a delante a sus familias solas.
texts.en:
The Picaflores De Los Chacos communal bank is comprised of 11 members, 10 women and 1 man.  Carmen, age 29, is the president of the bank.  She is not married,  but she lives with her life partner and their two children, ages 8, 4, and one on the way (she is 7 months pregnant).

Carmen sells meat.  She has a sales stand at one of the markets in the city of Santa Cruz.  She lives in the 23 de Diciembre area.
This is her second loan cycle in the institution.  Carmen will use this loan to buy a freezer.  This will allow her to keep the meat she sells in a good state.

Carmen does face challenges in her business.  The price of meat increases, and this makes meat scarce.  Carmen will use the profits to buy more meat.  This way she will be able to increase her sales, which will increase her income.  In time she wishes to have an equipped butcher shop.

Carmen is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful to the institution for the support given to her and her companions in the communal bank.  Some of the bank members get their families ahead by themselves.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Halit

texts.en:
Halit, a sixty-two-year-old married man with seven grown-up children, lives in a little village in Central Albania.  It is his first time requesting a loan and he is very grateful to the VFA and KIVA for the opportunity he’s been granted, because this loan will be a great help. 

Halit owns four “dynyms” of land where he grows veggies, grains and raises animals. Also, he has planted 600 plum trees. He sells the harvested produce to wholesale buyers. When Halit was asked about the progress of his business he said, “farming brings only happiness to me and all of my family together. I get the chance to work along with them every day.  Being in this business for twenty-one years now, I remember more good years than bad ones.  It has been going well and profitably, too. “ 

Halit loves the entire farming process of plowing, watering and harvesting, and his plans include growing the business.  With the profit that he has generated so far, he has been paying for  expenses related to his children such as schooling, marriages and building basic homes for his newly married children. “And this has drained my savings, otherwise I could afford building the irrigation system with no need for a loan. I cannot do the watering/draining manually, anymore,” Halit says.

loans.use: To build an irrigation system

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Coya en la provincia  de Calca departamento de Cusco.

La socia Francisca; la socia tiene 60 años, casada y tiene 6 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerveza y chicha (elaborado a base de maíz), la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales (cuyes), la socia trabaja todos los días en su negocio de venta de cerveza, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de cerveza para su negocio y de esta manera tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes. 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de cuyes, compra y venta de productos (cereales) venta de chicha, venta de granos secos, tienda de abarrotes.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjuntas pidieron permiso para llegar un poco tarde en la reunion.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank San Antonio de Padua. This bank is located in the district of Coya in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco.
The member in question is Francisca. She is 60 years old, married, and has 6 children. She combines her daily chores with a business selling beer and chica (a local corn-based drink). She has been doing this for years and this is how she has supported her family. She also works raising animals (guinea pigs). She works in her beer selling business every day. She is a cheerful and responsible person with a lot of will to keep working.
She is requesting a loan to buy beer for her business and in this way to have more to offer her customers. 
The other members work raising guinea pigs, buying and selling products (grains), selling chicha, selling dried grains, and running a grocery store.
The members who appear in the accompanying photo asked permission to arrive at the meeting a little late. 
The member appreciates this access to credit and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy beer for her business and in this way to have more to offer her customers.

loans.name: Crescent

texts.en:
Crescent is a 30-year-old man with three children. He is divorced but lives with his three children who are eight (twins) and 10. He also has one dependant, his niece, because his brother is incapable of taking good care of her. All the children attend school.

Crescent buys and sells goats and young bulls. He supplements the income from the above with farming. He started the business in 2007 and works every day of the week. He chose this business because he is experienced, having witnessed his father do it since he was a child.

He wants this particular loan to buy young bulls, which he will raise for three months and sell when the value has appreciated. He usually transports them to the city and sells them to abattoirs.

His dream is to see his business expand to big volumes so that he is able to transport many bulls at once. His major challenge is the death of the bulls due to sickness. At times there are quarantines when there is an outbreak of diseases like foot and mouth disease.

Crescent is a very hardworking and shrewd man.

loans.use: To buy bulls to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes, shoes, accessories and housewares.

loans.name: Muhibullo

texts.ru: Мухибулло житель города Истаравшан. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он у себя дома занимается птицеводством и продажей яиц. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. До этого он работал юристом. Сейчас он берет кредит для покупки птичьего корма с целью получения хороший яиц.
texts.en: Muhibullo is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 32 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Muhibullo is involved in poultry farming and selling eggs at home.  He has been in this business for two years.  Before this, he worked as a legal professional.  Currently, he is requesting this loan to buy bird feed in order to get good eggs.

loans.use: to buy feed for birds

loans.name: Zanja Honda Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ZANJA HONDA está  compuesto por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un  varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. María Jesús tiene 38 años no está casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene dos hijos  que tienen la edad de 5 y 14  años. Ella se dedica al elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería se encuentra en la localidad de  Zanja Honda, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María Jesús utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de harina y manteca para la elaboración de pan y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. María Jesús enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en  mejorar  la calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. María Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The venture bank Zanja Honda is comprised of 11 members: 10 women and one man. The president of the bank is María Jesús, who is 38 years old, un-married but living with her partner with whom she has two children of 5 and 14 years of age. She works making and selling bread. Her bakery is located in Zanja Honda. This loan is her first with the institution. María Jesús will use the loan to buy flour and butter  to make bread and so will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. María Jesús faces challenges in her business, including increasing her customer base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family. María Jesús is a very hardworking  person who is pleased and grateful that the institution offers to her and her group members.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter to make bread.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is a mechanic who is 35 years old and married. He has five children between 4 and 12 years old. Four of the children are in school. Esau repairs bicycles and sells bicycle spare parts. He works six days a week and his major clients are milk sellers who transport milk from the countryside to Lyantonde town using bicycles. He has been doing this business since 1993 because he had not attained formal education so he opted to train in mechanics. His dream is to own a big spare parts shop. The main challenge is theft of his spare parts and spanners by some clients and fellow workers.

Esau is hard working and determined to change his life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy shutters for the house

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas,ella vende manzanas,platanos,naranjas y uvas,la socia vende en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas,platanos y uvas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in her business selling fruits. She sells apples, bananas, oranges, and grapes. She sells in the market from 6:00am until 6:00pm. This business has enabled her to support her children. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her fruit. She is requesting a loan to buy apples, oranges, bananas, and grapes wholesale.
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, bananas, and grapes wholesale.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento El MIRADOR está  compuesto por nueve integrantes, seis mujeres y tres  varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Sofía tiene 42 años está casada tiene dos hijos  que tienen la edad de 5 y 14  años. Ella se dedica al elaboración y venta de empanadas, ella vive en la localidad de  la Guardia, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Sofía utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de harina y manteca para la elaboración de sus empanadas y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Sofía enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios en  mejorar  la calidad de vida a su familia, la Sra. Sofia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The venture bank El Mirador is comprised of 9 members, 6 women and 3 men. The president of the bank is Sofía. She is 42 years old, married, and has 2 children who are 5 and 14 year old. She works making and selling empanadas. She lives in La Guardia. This loan will be her first from the institution. Sofía will use the loan to buy flour and butter for making her empanadas and in this way will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. Sofía faces challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family. Sofía is a very hardworking person and she is pleased and grateful that the institute offers support to her and her group members.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter to make her empanadas.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis de 36 años, vive  en el municipio de Soledad,  con su esposo y sus 5 hijos  en las edades de 3 a 12 años de edad;  allí mismo desde hace 12 años, tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende mercancía variada como con una frecuencia diaria y también expande artículos como ropa, bermudas y utensilios para cocina por pedidos,  recibiendo los pagos semanales, quincenales y mensuales. Sus clientes la identifican y la recomiendan, permanentemente, por eso el negocio está en proyección ascendente de sus ventas; ellos reconocen que en miscelánea pueden resolver muchas de sus necesidades  y le compran, pero Gladis tiene muchos artículos que rotan mas rápidamente que otros que le dan una rotación  total  a sus inventarios de 63 días. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará ropa femenina e infantil y electrodomésticos menores,  artículos que le ofrecen una venta rápida y mas capacidad de ingresos. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa para mejorar el bienestar de su familia, pues  en la medida en que sus hijos crecen, aumentan sus necesidades. Mientras esto ocurre, en su negocio se expresa una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 47 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento.
texts.en: 36 year old Gladis lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and 5 children, who are between 3 and 12 years old. She has had a general store in the same town for 12 years. Here she sells various goods on a daily basis and also sells items such as clothes, shorts, and cooking utensils to order, taking payment weekly, fortnightly, and monthly. Her clients identify her and recommend her, and so the business has projected increasing sales. Her customers recognize that they can find and buy many of their necessities in her store. But, Gladis has some items that rotate through her store much more quickly than others, and she has a total inventory rotation of 63 days. This is why she came to Kiva to get her first loan through Foundation Maro Santo Domingo with which she will buy women's and children's clothes and small electrical appliances - items that sell quickly and make a good profit. Her long-term goal is to have her own house to improve the wellbeing of her family as her children's needs increase as they get older. Meanwhile, she wants to get her business inventory rotation to 47 days as this is a financial indicator from which we project growth.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing and small electrical appliances.

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Yusufu, who is in his late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school.  He has had a library business for eight years now.  He works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy another TV set for some video shows, some land, equipment for building his house, more CDs and DVDs, and paid household expenses. He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more equipment for the library. His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Mtazamo, which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for the library

loans.name: Ignacio Warnes Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento IGNACIO WARNES está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un  varon, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Jacinta Es la que esta vestida con una blusa amarilla, chamarra azul con rayas celestes en las mangas, pantalón  bluyín,   se encuentra al lado de la secretaria quien porta el libro de actas, La Sra. Jacinta tiene 33 años y no es casada pero convive con su pareja  con el que tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 años y 2años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene su tienda que se encuentran ubicado en la zona Ignacio Warnes de ahí el nombre de la banca,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jacinta va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada de invierno y así de esta manera incrementa su capital de trabajo,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es invertir en mercadería, la Sra. Jacinta  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios incrementar su mercadería y  sueña para su negocio es adquirir una tienda en un mercado, la Sra. jacinta es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The venture bank IGNACIO WARNES is made up of eight members: seven women and one man.  The president of the bank is Señora Jacinta, who is the one wearing a yellow blouse, blue jacket with light-blue stripes on the sleeves, and jeans.  She is next to the secretary, who is carrying the notebook with the minutes. 

Señora Jacinta is 33 years old and is not married, but she lives with partner with whom she has two children aged 3 and 2 years old.  She works selling clothing.  She has a store located in the Ignacio Warnes neighborhood, from which the bank takes its name.

This loan will be her first lending cycle with the institution.  Señora Jacinta will use this loan for the purchase of seasonal clothing for winter, and in this way will increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to invest in merchandise.  Señora Jacinta faces challenges in her business, namely her competition, and she will use her profits to increase her merchandise.  Her dream for her business is to acquire a store in a market.

Señora Jacinta is a very hard-working person, who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her and her companions in the group.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for winter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ruzibuvish

texts.ru: Рузибувиш замужем имеет 6 детей. Ее муж находиться в Росийской Федерации на заработках.Сама нигде не работает потому что не имеет образования.Но Розибувиш не сидит сложа руки,она дома  занимается откормом скота.Ее дети помогают в разведении коз и овец.У нее еще есть братья которые помогают ей покупать и продовать скот.Она планирует увеличить поголовье скота и на копленные деньги обучить своих детей поэтому обратилась в нашу организацию.Заранее благодарит за финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Ruzibuvish is married and has six children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work.  She is not employed anywhere because she does not have education.  But Ruzibuvish does not sit there with hands down and instead she is involved in fattening up livestock at home.  Her children help her with breeding goats and sheep.  She also has brothers who help her to buy and sell livestock.  Ruzibuvish plans to increase the livestock headcount and use the savings to educate her children, and this is why she came to our organization.  She is grateful in advance for the financial help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are already working, while the third is in high school. By the grace of God, Alma has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. Most Filipino parents, like Alma, as she herself has been a college undergraduate, believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Alma maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are relying on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a farm. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Alma dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Анварчон житель города города Исфара. Ему 22 года. Он женат. Анварчон вместе с сестрой и матерью занимается торговлей тканей. В этой области он год. Кредит берет для покупки нескольких видов тканей.
texts.en: Anvarjon is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 22 years old, married.  Anvarjon, his sister and mother are involved in selling fabrics.  He has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan to buy several types of fabrics.

loans.use: to buy new types of fabrics

loans.name: Jones

texts.en:
Jones is married and has a three-year-old child.  He sells clothes to earn a living.  He works hard in his business to provide for his family.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  
He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam is 34 years old and studied up to intermediate school. She is very supportive in nature and sews clothes to financially support her husband who has a motorcycle showroom. He makes deals of motorbikes from his show room. He started this business two years ago.  

Shabnam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for establishing her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy a motorbike that will allow him to earn more profts by selling.  Shabaum is confident that his business will get more established after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for show room business

loans.name: Houriya Group

texts.en:
Houriya is the featured borrower for Houriya's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is seated on the right. She has been working in the agriculture business for 30 years, and does well in her business because of the good quality products she plants and sells.
Houriya is a hard working widowed woman, mother of two children Najlaa (female-44 years) & Ahmad (Male-40 years). She spent her life in raising and teaching her children and taking the role of both the mother and the father.

Houriya is well known in the region, because of her good reputation. Houriya faced some obstacles at the beginning, since she was a woman and needed help.  She wasn't capable of requesting help from others, because she couldn't afford paying them.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner,  Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary seeds and fertilizers for her business.
This is her first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she believes that it will be have a positive impact on her business. She hopes to plow her land in the future, and to increase her production.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers necessary for her business

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children.  One of them currently attends school. For the past 3 years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more salon items, like cosmetics and hair waves, and will help Jackie to generate greater profits and increase her income. Jackie hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life. 

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more salon items, like cosmetics and hair waves

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has a 20-year-old child. For the past three years, she has run a grocery to earn a living and she also sells clothes to supplement her income.  Since Halima joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has learned business management skills.  

Halima is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie Madeleine est une femme de 41 ans veuve, mère de 7 enfants et 3 petits fils dont l'age varie entre 7 et 27 ans. Quatre vont encore à l'école.  Elle a ouvert un atelier de couture qu'elle gère depuis un ans et se debrouille bien. Dans cet atelier, pour pas attendre que le client emmêne le tissu, elle achète souvant les tissus qu'elle cout avant de vendre. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les tissus et mercerie pour pouvoir vendre aux client avant la confection des vêtements. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulEment pour la confection des vêtements mais aussi pour la vente de ses tissus et de satisfaire la clientèle. Ce bénéfice l'aidera économiser pour les rentrées scolaires de ses enfants et petits enfants, emenager son local et s'achter une machine dans le futur.
texts.en: Marie Madeleine is a 41 year old widow with 7 children and 3 grandchildren between the ages of 7 and 27. Four of them are in school. She opened a sewing shop one year ago and has been doing very well. In her workshop, she also sells the fabric to her clients so she doesn't have to wait for them to bring the fabric themselves. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabric and notions to sell to her clients before tailoring their outfits. This allows her to make a profit on the sale of the fabric as well as from her tailoring services. With the profits, she intends to save for her children and grand-children's school fees, maintain her household and purchase a new sewing machine in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials (fabric and notions)

loans.name: Les Militan De Ferrier 2 Group

texts.fr:
Juslene est la coordonatrice de son groupe Les Militan de Ferrier 2. Elle habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est mariée et a 3 enfants.

Juslene a dirigé son commerce de produit alimentaire. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans plusieurs produit. Des autres membres des Les Militan de Ferrier 2 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmétiques.

Juslene dit que son défit principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage. Elle Elle est très enthousiaste quant à son deuxième prêt et nous dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’elle devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Juslene is the coordinator of the group Les Militan de Ferrier 2. She lives in the CAP-H region, Haiti where there is limited electricity and water resources. She is married and has three children.

Juslene manages a business of selling food products. She intends to use this loan to invest in various food products. The other members of the group Les Militan de Ferrier 2 also need the loan to buy products for resale such as food products, charcoal and cosmetics.

Juslene says her biggest challenge is a lack of clientele because of high unemployment. She is very enthusiastic about receiving her second loan and has a dream to grow her business so she can become a wholesaler.

loans.use: d'acheter divers produits alimentaires

loans.name: Noa

texts.fr: Noa est une femme âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont l'âge varie entre entre 07 et 39 ans. elle mène une activité de vente de frais et plus précisément la tomate depuis 14 ans dans un marché de la place. elle voudrait avec ce crédit augmenter son stock permanent de marchandise afin de résoudre le problème de rupture dont elle est souvent victime. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle compte dans l'avenir agrandir son comptoir et diversifier sa marchandise afin de mieux assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que leur condition de vie.
texts.en: Noa is 58 year old, married and the mother of 6 children between the ages of 7 and 39. She has been selling fresh vegetables, specifically tomatoes, at the market place for the past 14 years. With this loan, she would like to fully restock her inventory so she no longer runs out of tomatoes to sell. She has often had that problem in the past. She has a lot of experience in this business. She hopes to grow her business and diversify her inventory to have more profits to pay her children's school expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to strengthen her stock of goods.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es:
Edinson tiene 35 años, es un hombre bueno, trabajador y con visión de negocio. Es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, todo lo que genera es dedicado a sus padres, con quienes vive hasta ahora, a lado de su hermana. Él dedica mucho de su vida para brindar lo mejor a su familia y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la compra de granos como maíz y frijol. El maíz lo procesa para venderlo como alimento para pollos, tiene un pequeño molino que constituyó con un amigo y socio. Juntos trabajan y distribuyen en un mercado céntrico de la ciudad y en diferentes puestos de la ciudad. Lleva haciendo este trabajo 4 años, y le permitió independizarse y obtener ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre está disponiendo de su tiempo y puede darse el gusto de andar por toda la ciudad. Le está yendo bien, gana un promedio del 15 % de su inversión y lo vuelve a invertir cada tres días. Como todo joven empresario tiene un objetivo, el cual es tener su propio taller para realizar el procesamiento él mismo y generar más ganancias. Pero por ahora está juntando capital, ya que lo que necesita es seguir invirtiendo en lo que tiene.

Éste es su cuarto préstamo con MFP. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más granos de maíz para seguir con su trabajo de procesamiento, también adquirirá granos de frijol para realizar la venta al por mayor.
texts.en:
Edinson, age 35, is a good man who is also hardworking and has business insight. He is single and has no children, so everything he earns is set aside for his parents. Edinson lives with them now, along with his sister. He has dedicated much of his life to providing the best for his family and improving their quality of life. His work consists of buying dry goods, such as corn and beans. The corn is processed so that it can be sold as chicken feed. He has a small grain mill that he shares with a friend and another member. They work and sell at the central market of the city and at various posts within the city. Edinson has been in this line of work for four years and it has allowed him to become independent and earn income. What he enjoys about his work is always having time available and taking pleasure in being able to walk around the entire city. He is doing well and earns an average return of 15% from his investment, which is then reinvested every three days. Like all young entrepreneurs, Edinson wants to have his own shop where he can process his goods himself and generate more income. For now, he is accumulating the capital he needs so that he can continue investing in what he has.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Once again, just as he did with his previous loans, he promises to complete his loan payments. Edinson is also grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The amount of 2,000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more corn kernels so that he can continue his processing business. He will also acquire beans that he can sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to process and sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Luisito and they have four children. One of their children has a family, two are in high school, and one is working. Emelita works hard to provide for the expenses of their everyday lives. She operates a business renting apartments to people who need a place to stay. She also earns an income through a small fruit farm where she grows pineapples and mangoes and earns a minimum of 825 PHP daily.

Emelita is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to maintain her apartments and her farm. This loan will be a really big help for her family, and Emelita expects a boost in her business income as she expands.  She dreams of sending the rest of her children to school and of starting more businesses other than her apartment and farm businesses. Emelita faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and products needed in her businesses

loans.name: Badam

texts.en:
Badam is 52 years old and is widowed. He lives with his son in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt. Badam runs a passenger minivan service between two outdoor bazaars in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving a car for many years. He used to work as a driver in a company but left that job due to a poor salary. Badam's vehicle has become badly damaged and he is unable to use it in his business.

Badam is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle and buy spare parts to repair his minivan. He believes his business will be easier and more profitable after his minivan is repaired.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his minivan

loans.name: Nagzigul

texts.ru: Нагзигул проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети и муж находятся в Российской Федерации. Она сама портниха по специальности. Сейчас Нагзигул предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки и необходимых материалов.
texts.en: Nagzigul lives in the Kumsangir district. She is 46 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband and children are living in Russia. Nagzigul is a dressmaker by trade, and she works out of her home. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and other necessary materials.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other necessary materials

loans.name: Jerioth

texts.en:
Jerioth is married and has three children. For the past seven years, she has been running a grocery business to earn a living. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Jerioth has grown her business because she has learned business management skills.

Jerioth is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and employ people.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Fernande Olanihou

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Fernande Olanihou est mariée et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commercialise des produits de la SOBEBRA depuis 19 ans. Fernande Olanihou s'approvisionne dans l'un des dépôts de Cotonou et les distribue dans les buvettes proches de sa résidence. Elle veut disposer des casiers de bière et de sucrerie afin de satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle, raison pour laquelle Fernande Olanihou a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev.
texts.en: Fernande Olanihou is 46 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who all attend school. She has been selling SOBEBRA products for 19 years. Fernande Olanihou buys her inventory in Cotonou and sells them to small business near her home. She would like to have an inventory of beer and soft drinks to satisfy her clients' demands which is why she is working with Finadev to receive this loan.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cases of beer and 10 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Hadjaratou

texts.fr: Mariée, âgée de 52 ans, Hadjaratou est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle  vend  des galettes, arachides et huiles d'arachide dans l'un des marchés de la place. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont souvent des revendeuses. Hadjaratou veut s'acheter des bidons d'huile, des paniers de galette et des mesures d'arachide. Afin de renforcer son commerce, Hadjaratou a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit  auprès de Finadev.
texts.en: Hadjaratou is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children who have all attended school. She sells biscuits, peanuts and peanut oil in the market place. She purchases her inventory at one of the markets in Benin and her clients are also often retailers. Hadjaratou would like to buy oil, biscuits and peanuts for resale. In an effort to strengthen her business, Hadjaratou has requested and received this loan from Finadev.

loans.use: 6 25 liter bottles of oil, 6 bundles of peanuts and 4 baskets of biscuits.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'aîné a 15 ans et le benjamin 06 ans. Tous les trois vont à l'école. Elle vend les articles de quincaillerie qu'elle achète à l'extérieur du pays. Justine dispose déjà d'une clientèle potentielle à qui elle livre les articles aussitôt revenue du marché. Elle veut s'acheter des cartons de clé, tournevis, clous, rouleaux de grillage en plastique et métallique. Justine avec ses économies veut satisfaire ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Justine is married and the mother of three children; her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 6.  All three attend school.

Justine sells hardware goods which she purchases abroad.  Justine already has a good group of regular customers, to whom she delivers her goods as soon as she is back from the market.  She wants to buy boxes of wrenches, screwdrivers, nails, and rolls of plastic and metal mesh.

With her savings, Justine intends to meet her personal needs as well as those of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of wrenches, 1 box of screwdrivers, 1 box of nails, 2 rolls of plastic mesh and 2 rolls of metal mesh.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunta;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picanteria ella vende diversos tipos de platos tipicos,la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia a la vez vende chicha y cerveza,la socia es una persona alegre y resposable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de insumos para elaborar chicha como maiz. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the Madres Trabajadoras [Working Mothers] community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the Cusco province and department. 

Asunta alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she sells various kinds of traditional meals. She works every day at her business, as this is her way of getting her family ahead. At the same time she sells chicha [a corn based drink] and beer. Asunta is a cheerful and responsible person with a strong desire to get ahead in life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy goods, such as corn, to make chicha. 

Asunta is happy to have the loan and promises to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy goods to make chicha [a corn based drink], such as corn.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas tiene 24 años es soltero con una hija,  es de la ciudad de Paraguarí. Blas se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace aproximadamente un año, pero ya había empezado en esto hace  más de 3 años como cobrador ya que casi toda su familia trabaja en este mismo ramo y con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada y  zonas de trabajo.
El vende frazadas, sabanas, prendas, zapatos, jeans y todo tipo de artículos, con lo cual tiene los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Blas solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, calzados, camperas y demás artículos para la venta, con lo que podrá aumentar sus zonas de venta y tendrá un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Blas is 24 years old, single, and has a daughter. He is from the city of Paraguarí. Blas has been a "macate" (traveling merchant) for approximately one year. However, he began working as a collector and was in that line of work for three years because almost everyone in his family works in the same field. Blas earns a very good monthly income because he already has an established customer base and existing sales territories. He sells blankets, bed sheets, clothes, shoes, jeans, and all types of products. Selling this merchandise enables him to generate the necessary income to help his family.

Blas is requesting a loan to buy jeans, shoes, jackets, and other products to sell so that he can expand his sales territories and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, jackets, and other products.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt:
Casada mãe de 1 filho que ainda continua com os Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negocio há mais de 3 anos e vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, óleo, açúcar, amendoim, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

No futuro pretende continuar com os seus estudos e dedicar-se cada vez mais ao seu negócio para aumentar a sua renda. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, concluir a sua casa através da renda do seu negócio para melhor confortar a sua família.
texts.en:
Delfina is married and has one son who still goes to school. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been a businesswoman and the owner of her own business for more than three years. Delfina sells staple goods. She intends to use this loan to buy products (flour, oil, sugar, peanuts, rice and other items) to increase the amount of merchandise she has in stock.

In the future, she intends to continue with her studies and devote herself even more to her business so she can increase her income. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can ask for another loan.

One of Delfina's challenges is using her income to finish her house so she can make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (flour, oil, sugar, peanuts, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Myagmardagva

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmardagva, 49 runs a freight transportation business around Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2004, he has been running his business, and he usually carries construction materials between two points. Currently, he lives with his wife on his plot of land.  All his children moved out of their parent’s house.

He wanted to renovate his old house to run a grocery store in the roof hollow space. He thinks that this business will increase the income of his family and improve their living conditions in the future. Now he needs a loan to buy the building materials to renovate his roof hollow for opening the grocery store.

loans.use: To buy the building materials to renovate his roof hollow for opening a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda, 48, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Florante who works in aircraft maintenance, and is the mother of three children. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Rosalinda believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Rosalinda operates an internet café business. There is more need now for services like these as demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume, or for any office documentation.  She has people who would just love to surf the net and any social network. She also operates a variety store and she has an apartment available for rentals. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2500 in profit every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional computer, mouse, keyboard, mouse pad, and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Rosalinda dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ismail has been working hard to manage his big kraal, which sells cattle. 

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle for resale, and will help Ismail to generate greater profits and increase his income. Ismail hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a hardware business and a bigger farm. 

Ismail is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ismail who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance, 27 years old, is married and has one child. She sells sweet potatoes and cassava. She would like to use this loan to get more sweet potatoes for the store because most of the customers like them very much. Esperance will use the profits from the business for savings in order to accumulate capital for the future.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Chie

texts.en:
Chie is 61 years old and a resident of the Prey Chor district. Her family's main business is rice farming and Chie can earn a suitable living to raise her family. She spends most of her time working in the fields to ensure a high crop production, especially in the rainy season. Being a responsible mother, Chie is determined to ensure a good future for her children. Four of her children are already married and the remaining one is still single.

Chie is requesting a loan from HKL, a long-standing Kiva partner, to purchase a motorcycle for home use. This will provide good transportation services for her family and allow them to go anywhere they wish to go. Chie's business goal is to expand the size of her land and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use

loans.name: Jadeo

texts.en:
Jadeo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, both currently in school. For the past 8 years, Jadeo has been working hard to manage his big kraal, which sells cattle. 

To help expand his business, Jadeo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle for resale, and will help Jadeo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jadeo hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Jadeo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jadeo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale,

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine, 29 years old, has three children aged between 6 and 9, all attending school. She has been selling skirts for two years. Francine has realized that her business needs more capital, so she has requested a loan to increase the volume of her business. She will use the profits from the business to help upgrade it.

loans.use: To buy more shirts to sell.

loans.name: Sèmèton Germain
