También le gusta su labor porque le permite despejar su mente por las tardes, ya que sólo utiliza medio día para limpiar o cosechar en su chacra. Nota que cada día le va mejor, debido al buen cuidado que aprendió a dar a sus plantas. Espera seguir trabajando mucho, pues desea tener una mejor producción cada año.

Este es su crédito número 15 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece, ya que todos son muy responsables. 
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará abono para fertilizar sus tierras, y algunas herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Valentín is 38 years of age, and is a good man who is friendly and very hard-working. He is married to Edith who is 40 years of age, and together they have two sons named Jorge and Daniel (both are 11 years of age). Valentín works a lot so that he can have a good quality of life alongside his family.


Valentín grows cassava and other regional products in the six hectares of farmland he owns. He plants his crops depending on the season and ensures good produce, as he takes great care with the fertility of his crops’ roots, which make for larger produce with better flavor. He has been working in this business for five years, and is very happy to have the help of his wife, with whom he cultivates his plots of land. He also enjoys his work because it allows him to relax in the afternoons, as he only uses the first half of the day to clean or harvest his land. Valentín has seen his business improve day by day, due to the way in which he carefully looks after his produce. He hopes to continue working a lot, as he plans to improve his production every year.


This is Valentín’s 15th loan from MFP, and he is happy to know that he can get a loan to help him meet his goals. He promises to make his payments on time and to not make a bad impression on the group he belongs to, as they are all very responsible.



He plans to use the requested loan of 3,000 soles to buy fertilizer for his land and various tools for his work.

loans.use: To buy compost and tools.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.es:
Yelena tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y responsable. Junto a su pareja tienen un hijo de 6 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia e intentan dar lo mejor a su hijo, una buena calidad de vida y educación.
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de bebidas. Además posee un motocarro que alquila y por el cual le dan un pago diario. Adicionalmente, tiene una pequeña chacra de la que se encarga su pareja. Lleva haciendo estas actividades 2 años y lo que le gusta es que trabaja a lado de su hijo, ya que el tiempo le da para poder cuidarlo. Su casa está ubicada en un punto estratégico de su zona y por eso tiene clientes todos los días y todo el tiempo, esto le genera buenas ventas.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia responsable de los créditos obtenidos. Le gusta pertenecer a su banco comunal porque todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará repuestos para su motocarro, pagará al mecánico que lo refaccionará y comprará más bebidas para su venta.
texts.en:
Yelena is 39 years of age and is a happy, friendly and responsible woman. With her partner she has a six-year-old son. They live in their own house and try to give the best to their son – good quality of life and education.

Yelena sells drinks, and also owns a three-wheeler van which she rents out for a daily fee. She also has a small farm which is managed by her partner. She has been carrying out this business for two years, and she enjoys being able to work with her son beside her so she can look after him. Her house is located in a strategic part of her area, and she therefore has customers all the time every day, generating good sales.

This is Yelena’s fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support to help her continue increasing her working capital. She is sure that she will continue to be responsible with the loans she obtains. She likes being part of her communal bank as they are all very responsible and have a strong sense of solidarity.

Yelena plans to use the requested amount of 2,500 soles to buy replacement parts for her van, pay the mechanic who will repair it, and buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To repair her three-wheeler van.

loans.name: Felizmina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filha que ainda continua com os Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 1 sobrinha e uma neta que vivem com ela. 
É professora, com presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para obra da sua casa (blocos, cimento, ferro, e outros).

No futuro pretende continuar com os Estudos e fazer um negócio para reforçar a renda familiar. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, iniciar um negócio com fundo próprio para garantir o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en:
Felizmina is single and the mother of 1 daughter who is still at School, lives in her own house with her family and supports a niece and a granddaughter who also live with her.

She is a teacher and with this loan she intends to purchase materials for the construction of her house (blocks, cement, iron and others).

In future Felizmina intends to continue with her Studies and start a business to reinforce her family's income. She commits to duly paying off the loan in order to be able to solicit further loans.

Her challenge is to start a business with her own funds to guarantee her family's well-being.

loans.use: buy construction material for her house (blocks, cement, iron and others).

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is 40 years old. She is married with five children, all of whom go to school. For the past five years, Euphrasie has been selling clothes and bed sheets.

Euphrasie is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and bed sheets to sell. She anticipates saving the profits from her loan for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en: Denyse is 24 years old. She is married to a businessman who sells phone accessories. She sells sorghum and millet flour. She has spent three years in the business and with the loan, she wants to add more sorghum for sale. The expected profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 58 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy entusiasta. Está separada de su esposo, pero tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales solo uno está con ella y depende de ella para su educación y alimentación. La casa de Zoila es propia, la cual pudo adquirir con bastante esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Su trabajo comienza cuando se dirige, muy temprano, a su chacra donde cultiva, regar y prepara la tierra, y donde también produce miel de abeja. Viene trabajando en esto cerca de 30 años, con lo que educó y alimentó a sus hijos. Aprendió esta actividad desde muy joven, ya que lo heredó de sus padres, ahora ella lo está enseñando a su menor hijo, quien después de volver del colegio se va a ayudarla y así aprende de negocio familiar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con su hijo, además tiene buenas ventas, ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son de buena calidad y los lleva al mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Su deseo a futuro es empezar a sembrar otro tipo de productos para incrementar sus ganancias.

Este es su crédito número 17 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Además está convencida que seguirá siendo responsable como con los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal, pues sus compañeros que todos responsables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará granos, semillas y pagará a algunos peones para preparar sus tierras para la siembra. También invertirá en su negocio de apicultura.
texts.en:
Zoila is 58 years of age and is a happy, friendly woman who is very enthusiastic. She is separated from her husband but has five children, only one of whom still lives with her and depends on her for education and food. Zoila owns her own house, which she obtained after a lot of effort and sacrifice.


Her working day starts very early when she goes to her small farm, where she works, waters and prepares the land, and where she also produces bee honey. She has been working in this business for almost 30 years, and has used the income to educate and feed her children. She learned this activity from a young age, as she inherited the business from her parents. She is now teaching it to her youngest son, who helps her and learns the family business when he comes home from school. What Zoila enjoys about her business is that she has time and can share it with her son. She also has good sales, as the produce she obtains from her land is of good quality and she takes it to the city’s wholesale market. In the future she hopes to sow other produce to increase her income.


This is her 17th loan from MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have the financial support she needs to continue increasing her working capital. She is also sure that she will remain responsible, as she was when repaying her former loans. She enjoys being part of her communal bank, as they are all responsible and support one another.


With the requested loan of 2,500 soles, Zoila plans to buy grain and seeds and to pay agricultural workers to prepare her land for sowing. She also wants to invest in her beekeeping business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire agricultural workers.

loans.name: Cerro Bala Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Cerro Bala esta conformado por once personas humildes e indígenas con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y darle una mejor vida a su familia. Los integrantes de este grupo son originarios de San Juan Jicayan  donde la mayoría de los cuidadnos se dedican a la siembra de maíz y a la ganadería. 

Una de las integrantes de grupo es la señora Soledad una señora amable,trabajadora y humilde con deseos de salir adelante. Doña Sole como mejor la conocen nos dice que se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pan desde hace veinte años. Nos cuenta que entrega pan para bodas y xv años ya que para sus paisanos ella hace el mejor pan de su región. Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de más materiales para la elaboración de pan como son harina, huevos, leche, levadura, royal, manteca y mantequilla.

Está felizmente casada con el señor Perfecto con quien tiene tres hijos a quienes quiere mucho y en ocasiones le ayudan a hacer el pan.

Le da las gracias a fundacion por la ayuda que le ha dado para que su negocio crezca cada día más.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Antonia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Tomasa- se dedica a la venta de ladrillos.
Emilia- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Petra – se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Natividad- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Juan- se dedica a la venta de ladrillos.
Leobardo- se dedica a la venta de ladrillos.
Zoila- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Epifania- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Juana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente indígena y trabajadora.

*El señor de camisa anaranjada que aparce en la foto es el esposo de la señora Soledad y no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
This group is called Cerro Bala and has 11 members. They are all humble, indigenous people who want to improve their quality of life and provide their families with better conditions. The group’s members are from San Juan Jicayan, where the majority of the population works in corn growing and livestock farming.


One of the group’s members is Soledad, who is a friendly, hard-working and humble woman who wants to get ahead in life. Sole, as she is known, bakes and sells bread, and has done so for the past 20 years. She delivers bread for weddings and quinceañeras (galas for girls' 15th birthdays), and the people in her area think she makes the best bread in the region. She has asked for this loan to buy more products to bake bread, such as flour, eggs, milk, yeast, baking powder, lard and butter.

Sole is happily married to Perfecto. They have three children whom she loves very much, and sometimes they help her to bake the bread. She would like to thank the foundation for the help that it has given her so that her business can grow every day.


The group’s other members are:

Antonia - she sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes.
Tomasa - she sells bricks.
Emilia - she sells chickens.
Petra - she sells chickens.
Natividad- she sells chickens.
Juan - he sells bricks.
Leobardo - he sells bricks.
Zoila - she sells chickens.
Epifania-  she sells bread.
Juana - she sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes.


They would all like to thank the foundation for helping hard-working, indigenous people.

*The man in the orange shirt in the photo is Soledad’s husband, and does not belong to the group.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José de 39 años  vive al suroccidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 9 a 12 años. Desde hace un poco mas de 12 años, está dedicado a las actividades del comercio, mediante las cuales vende sillas, armarios, cómodas, escaparates, que distribuye a crédito entre sus clientes y cobra en plazos semanales,, quincenales o mensuales, de acuerdo con la negociación realizada con cada uno. Así mismo fabrica antenas para recepcionar señales de telecomunicaciones, producto con el cual se encuentra muy satisfecho, porque tiene mucha acogida en el mercado de la ciudad. Su meta es lograr el crecimiento sostenido de su microempresa y conseguir su permanecía en el mercado. Su mayor desafío es que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para lograr sus sueños de ensanchamiento y esto es justamente lo que conseguirá con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía variada como mecedoras, artículos eléctricos, electrodomésticos menores y materiales para elaborar antenas para televisores, producto del que tiene muchos pedidos. Con su inversión tiene un potencial de éxito, en cuanto a su experiencia empresarial en el mercado al que quiere impactar y su disciplina de trabajo, acompañada de que amplia la capacidad de compra, para ofertar un nuevo mercado y esto es lo que necesita.
texts.en:
José is 29 years of age and lives in the south-west of the city. He lives with his spouse and three children, aged between 9 and 12. For just over 12 years he has worked selling items such as chairs, closets, chests of drawers and sideboards. He sells these on credit to his customers, and collects weekly, twice-monthly or monthly installments from them, depending on the terms agreed with each. He also manufactures antennae to receive telecommunication signals, and he is happy with this product as it is well-accepted in the city market. 

José’s goal is to ensure the sustained growth of his micro-business and to remain in the market. His biggest challenge is a lack of working capital to expand his business. This is precisely what he wants to do with his Kiva loan, his first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. He plans to use the loan to buy various items such as rocking chairs, electrical items, small household appliances and materials to make TV antennae, a product for which he has many orders. 

He thinks his investment has potential for success due to his business experience in the market in which he wants to make an impact, as well as his work ethic. He will also be able to increase his purchasing power, allowing him to offer goods to a new market, which is just what he needs.

loans.use: To buy various items such as rocking chairs, electrical items, small household appliances and materials to make TV antennae.

loans.name: Sanza Plus Group

texts.en:
Martinette is the Chairwoman of the group named “Sanza Plus” which means “Moon” in English made up of 16 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Martinette was elected by the group to succeed Antoinette who would like to focus on her businesses this cycle. Martinette sells beverages to the east of Kinshasa. She has been in business since 2005. She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance program) in 2010 and received seven loans, all of which she has paid back regularly. She has worked hard to develop her business. With the high demand of the clients, Martinette intends with the next loan to buy 10 crates of drinks and some miscellaneous goods in bulk for resale at a profit and increase her income. She hopes to generate more profit to support her family. Currently, her business generates about US$150 of profit per week. Martinette’s ambition is to open a beverage facility and deliver beverages in her environment. She is 26 years old and a mother of five children whose ages vary between 1 and 12. Three of them go to school.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks and miscellaneous goods in bulk for resale

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamín  de 52 años de edad vive con su esposa y tiene 8 hijos en edades de 10 a 27 años. Él desde hace aproximadamente 10 años, se dedica a la elaboración de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, como pan de dulce, pan piñita, pan de molde, tortas, pudines, panes de sal y bizcochería, las cuales distribuye entre vecinos del sector donde reside, a quienes les vende los productos que consumen en su desayuno o en su cena y en algunas tiendas, que les compran parte de su producción. Su meta es lograr el crecimiento de su microempresa, para fortalecer el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor desafío es que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a la creciente demanda, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como harina de trigo, azúcar, grasas, y levaduras, para  ganar descuentos por compras en mayor volumen y ganar dinero, con el cual aumentar su capital de trabajo y así mismo empezará el ascenso hacia el logro de sus metas a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 52 years of age, lives with his wife and has eight children aged between 10 and 27. For approximately 10 years he has prepared products using wheat flour, such as sweet bread, piñita bread (another kind of sweet bread), sliced bread, cakes, puddings, savory bread and pastries. He distributes these among the neighbors of the area he lives in, selling these products to be eaten with breakfast or dinner. He also makes sales to a number of stores which buy some of his goods. 

His goal is to expand his micro-business to ensure the wellbeing of his family. His biggest challenge is that he lacks sufficient working capital to meet growing demand. This is precisely why he has requested a Kiva loan, his first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials such as wheat flour, sugar, lard and yeast, obtaining discounts for bulk purchases. He will therefore increase his working capital and start moving towards meeting his long-term goals.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wheat flour, sugar, lard and yeast.

loans.name: Erika Maria

texts.es: Erika de 31 años de edad vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 años y 5 meses de nacido. Allí en su propio barrio, se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cosméticos, dulces, ropas, productos por catálogos, los cuales vende a crédito, en plazos pactados a la medida de cada cliente, a quienes cobra su cartera semanal, y en un plazo  máximo de tres cuotas. Su meta mas adelante es lograr convertir su negocio en una comercializadora y proveedora de mercancía variada en establecimientos pequeños. Su mayor desafío es que no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para comprar en mayor volumen y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos que le han encargado, como perfumes, cosméticos y dulces. Mientras trabaja para lograr el cumplimiento de sus sueños, maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de 18 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su crecimiento empresarial, con la aplicación  de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Erika is 31 years of age and lives in the south-west of the city, along with her spouse and two children aged seven years and five months. She works in her neighborhood selling perfumes, cosmetics, sweets, clothing and catalog products, which she sells on credit in accordance with the terms agreed with each customer. She collects a weekly payment from them, up to a maximum of three installments.

In the future she wants to change her business to start selling and supplying varied merchandise to small establishments. Her biggest challenge is the lack of working capital to make larger purchases. This is why she has requested a Kiva loan, her first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to use the money to buy products ordered from her, such as perfumes, cosmetics and sweets. While she works to meet her goals her accounts receivable period stands at 18 days, and she generates profit on sales within a period of no less than 18 days. These financial indicators have been used to project her business growth, along with application of the Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy products ordered from her such as perfumes, cosmetics and sweets.

loans.name: Flor De Mirto Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es muy trabajadora, tiene 48 años de edad, su esposo el señor Juan es campesino, tiene una familia integrada de 2 hijos quienes están estudiando, Guadalupe de 9 años cursa el 3° de primaria, Pedro tiene 12 años y cursa el 6° de primaria.
Guadalupe se dedica al negocio de frutas y verduras; tiene 15 años con su negocio y piensa que para tener más ganancias necesita tener más mercancía y piensa invertir su próximo préstamo más que nada para comprar más artículos y después poco a poco con sus ganancias darle mejor mantenimiento al lugar donde vende porque ella cree que este año las lluvias le va a afectar. Quiere hacer más grande el lugar de trabajo. 
Guadalupe es integrante del grupo Flor de Mirto tal grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras y responsables que a continuación serán mencionadas: Maria Lucena vende colchas, Isabel tiene la venta de refrescos, Guadalupe vende frutas y verduras, Eucaria vende verduras, Amairani vende colchas, Eddy Anai vende accesorios de belleza, Maria Victoria vende chilate, Elda vende ropa, Blanca vende tamales y Luisa vende frutas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is very hard-working. She is 48 years of age, and her husband Juan is an agricultural worker. She has two children who are studying: Guadalupe aged 9, who is in her third year of elementary school, and Pedro aged 12, who is in his sixth year of elementary school.

Guadalupe sells fruit and vegetables. She has had this business for 15 years, and thinks that to obtain more income she needs more products. She plans to mainly invest her next loan in buying more items and, little by little, to use her profits to improve the maintenance of the place where she sells her produce, as she thinks the rains will affect it this year. She wants to increase the size of the area where she works.


Guadalupe forms part of the Flor de Mirto group. It has ten members, all women and hard-working and responsible, who are: Maria Lucena who sells bedspreads; Isabel who sells sodas; Guadalupe who sells fruit and vegetables; Eucaria who sells vegetables; Amairani who sells bedspreads; Eddy Anai who sells beauty products; Maria Victoria who sells a drink called chilate; Elda who sells clothes; Blanca who sells tamales; and Luisa who sells fruit.

loans.use: To buy more products for her grocery store: soap, oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos continuam com os Estudos, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos, com presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, ferro, chapas de zinco, e outros) para ampliar a sua casa.

No futuro pretende melhorar as condições da sua residência e continuar a investir nos Estudos dos seus filhos até a sua formação. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, construir um estabelecimento onde possa expor seus produtos porque de momento ele é ambulante.
texts.en:
Florinda is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She is a businesswoman, and she has her own business selling a variety of items. She intends to use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, beams, iron, zinc sheets and other items) to add on to her house.

In the future, Florinda intends to improve the condition of her home and to continue investing in her children's education until they graduate. She promises to pay off the loan on time so she can ask for another loan.

One of her challenges is to build a store where she can display her products because right now she is a traveling saleswoman.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, beams, iron, zinc sheets, etc.) to add on to her house.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola e os outros já maiores, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É comerciante e dona do seu próprio negocio, com presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma mesa de bilhares para diversificar o seu produto e a aumentar a sua renda familiar.

No futuro pretende continuar com os Estudos e fazer um negócio para reforçar a renda familiar. Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder solicitar mais. 
Tem como desafios, iniciar uma nova parceria com outros comerciantes para aumentar a renda familiar e garantir o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en:
Herminia is single and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom attend School whereas the others are over 18. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.
She is a trader who owns her own business and with this loan she intends to buy a billiard table in order to diversify her products and increase her family's income.

In future Herminia intends to continue her Studies and reinforce her family's income through her business. She commits to duly paying off this loan so that she is able to solicit further loans.

Her challenge is to begin a new partnership with other traders in order to increase her family's income and guarantee their well-being.

loans.use: purchase a billiard table to increase her family's income

loans.name: Abuzuzanya Group

texts.fr:
Florent fait partie du groupe Abuzuzanya. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui ont mit leur force ensemble». Il a 44 ans, il est marie avec 8 enfants de 1 mois  à 18 ans, dont 6 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.
Florent est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en:
Florent is a member of the Abuzuzanya group. The name of the group means «those who joined forces». He is 44, married, and the father of 8 children between the ages of 1 month and 18 years, 6 of whom go to school. His education level is 8 years of primary school.
Florent is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

To increase his rice farming, he plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, he would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, he plans on paying his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

loans.name: Abesamihigo B Group

texts.fr:
Athanase fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo B. Le nom du groupe signifie «Des gents qui ont les performances». Il a 52 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 6 ans à 25 ans, dont 4  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Athanase is a member of the Abesamihigo B group. The name of this group means «People who achieve». He is 52, married, and the father of 6 children between the ages of 6 and 25, 4 of whom go to school. His education level is 6 years of primary school.

Athanase is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

To increase his rice farming, he plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, he would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, he plans on paying his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming

loans.name: Abesamihigo D Group

texts.fr:
Athanase fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo D. Le nom du groupe signifie «Des gents qui ont les performances». Il a 52 ans, il est marie avec 9 enfants de 9 ans à 29 ans, dont 7 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Athanase est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en:
Athanase is a member of the Abesamihigo D group. The name of this group means «People who achieve». He is 52, married, and the father of 9 children between the ages of 9 and 29, 7 of whom go to school. His education level is 6 years of primary school.

Athanase is a rice farmer. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

To increase his rice farming, he plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, he would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, he plans on paying his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is twenty-nine years old. She is married to Sammy and blessed with three children aged nine, seven and two. She runs a retail shop, a business she started two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested her first loan for KES 30,000 to purchase washing detergents, a sack of rice and one of sugar, cooking fats and juices to sell. 

The profit she earns will be ploughed back in her business. Her dream is to one day open a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase washing detergents, a sack of rice and one of sugar, cooking fats and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming

loans.name: Jewosiah

texts.en:
Josiah is thirty-five years old. He is married and blessed with three children aged seven, four and one. He has a wholesale stall where he sells assorted fruits. He has been in this business for twelve years now and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 25,000 to purchase more fruits to sell. The anticipated profit will help him repay his loan and cater for his family's needs. 

He dreams of buying a pick-up for his business for easy ferrying of fruits.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is aged thirty-six. She is a mother of four children who are aged between one and thirteen. She sells bed sheets and has spent five years in the business. 

The loan will be used to buy more bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build her home because she is very tired of renting.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Abahetsi Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne fait partie du groupe Abahetsi. Le nom du groupe signifie «les travailleurs». Elle a 28 ans, elle est marie avec 3 enfants de 2 mois  à 6 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Elle a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Jeanne est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, elle planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Abahetsi group. The name of this group means «the workers». She is 28, married, and the mother of 3 children between the ages of 2 months and 6 years, 2 of whom go to school. In addition to her children, she has one more dependent person. Her education level is 3 years of secondary school.

Jeanne is a rice farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for her rice farming.

To increase her rice farming, she plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, she would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, she plans on paying her children's school fees and her family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for her rice farming.

loans.name: Dushyirehamwe/ Kzr Group

texts.fr:
Théogène fait partie du groupe Dushyirehamwe/Kzr. Le nom du groupe signifie «ressemble nos forces». Il a 40 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 3mois  à 16 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Théogène est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille
texts.en:
Théogène is part of the Dushyirehamwe/Kzr group. The name of the group means “our strengths together”. He is 40 years of age and married with six children aged between three months and 16 years of age. Five of his children are at school. Théogène has six years of primary school education.

Théogène is a rice grower. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

To expand his rice-growing business he plans to request other loans. Over the coming years he would like to expand his rice paddies to satisfy market demand. With his profits he plans to pay his children’s school fees and his family’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and pay the labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is sixty-four years old. She is married to Kuto and they are blessed with five children aged between thirty-eight and twenty years old. She runs a cereals-selling business and has been in the business for ten years, earning an income of KES 40,000 per month. 

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. She successfully repaid her first loan. She will use the new loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd. to purchase more dry maize and beans for resale. 

She plans to plough the anticipated profits back into her cereal business. Her hope and dream is to open a grinding mill business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Twisungane Ruguti Group

texts.fr:
Fabien  fait partie du groupe Twisungane/ Rgt . Le nom du groupe signifie «s’entre aider». Il a 29 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1 an. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que son enfant. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Fabien est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Fabien is a member of the Twisungane/ Rgt group. The name of this group means «helping each other out». He is 29, married, and the father of a one-year-old child. In addition to his child, he has one more dependent person. His education level is 6 years of secondary school.

Fabien is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming.

To increase his rice farming, he plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, he would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, he plans on paying his children's school fees and his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for his rice farming

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is thirty-two years old. She is married to a businessman who sells clothes. Francine sells skirts and has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more skirts to sell. She plans to save the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a thirty-six-year-old businessman. He is married to Naomi who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with six children aged between four and fourteen. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 12,800 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Philip will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/ Shr Group

texts.fr:
Antoinette fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere/Shr. Le nom du groupe signifie «développer nos activités». Elle a 33 ans, elle est marie avec 1 enfants de 5 ans et il est scolarises. Elle a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Antoinette est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture de riz, elle planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a member of the Twitezimbere/Shr group. The name of this group means «developing our activities». She is 33, married, and the mother of a 5-year-old child who goes to school. In addition to her children, she has one more dependent person. Her education level is 6 years of primary school.

Antoinette is a rice farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for her rice farming.

To increase her rice farming, she plans on applying for other loans. In the coming years, she would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation to meet the demand. With the profits, she plans on paying her children's school fees and her family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay the workforce for her rice farming.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is twenty years old. A single lady, she has no dependants. She hawks body creams, a business she ventured into two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more body creams and other beauty products to sell. The profit she earns from this business will help her purchase more stock. 

Her dream is to see her business prosper as well as to improve her life style.

loans.use: To purchase body creams to sell.

loans.name: Anisia

texts.en:
Anisia is aged forty-four. She is a mother of two children aged fourteen and eighteen. She has sold bed sheets for four years.  

She wants the loan to buy more bed sheets, and bed covers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to help Anisia to renovate a house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is forty-two years old, married, and blessed with eight children aged twenty-one, nineteen, sixteen, twelve, eight, five and three year old twins.  She sells shoes from market to market, a business she started eight years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. to purchase more pairs of shoes to sell. The profit she earns will aid her to repay her loan and pay her children’s school fees. 

Her dream is to see her business excel and to invest more in other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is fifty years old. He is married to Priscilla and they are blessed with five children aged twenty, eighteen, sixteen, fourteen and twelve years old. He practices farming, a business he ventured into four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He has requested his fourth loan of KES 40,000 to purchase fertilizer, seeds and herbicides for the planting season. The anticipated profit will aid him educate his children. 

He hopes to continue farming and become a great farmer in his village.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane runs a business of buying and selling tea leaves. She has been in business for 15 years. She has had an increase in her monthly income to KES 20,000. Her business is doing well. She is requesting her fifth loan of KES 63,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use for purchasing a motorcycle for transporting her green tea leaves. The profits will given back to her business. Her dream is to venture into large-scale tea farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting her green tea leaves

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is thirty-two years old. She is married to Paul and is blessed with four children aged thirteen, seven, five and seven months. She runs a butcher shop, a business she started twelve years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a first loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a sheep for her business. The profit she earns will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is thirty-three years of age. He is married to Kerry, and they have two children, aged eight and three years old.  He runs a tailoring business, with a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Bernard is servicing his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd., after having successfully repaid the previous loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more textiles for use in the tailoring business. 

His hopes and dreams are to secure tenders from schools so that he will be making and supplying them with school uniforms.  Bernard also hopes to improve the living standards of his family and to provide his kids with a good education.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is fifty-four years old. She is married to Paulo and is blessed with four children aged thirty-eight, thirty-two, twenty-seven and twenty-one. She has rental houses which she built twenty years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the rent. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase materials to renovate the houses. Profit from her business will help her repay her loan. Her dream is build more rental houses so as to have additional income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for renovating her rental rooms.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-seven years old, married, and blessed with three children aged twelve, six and three. She runs a retail shop, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase four bales of flour, bathing soaps, bars of soap, tea leaves and five crates of soda. 

The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business and part of it will be used to repay her loan. Her dream is to one day have a bigger business as well as venture into other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase four bales of flour, bathing soap, bars of soap, tea leaves and five crates of soda.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric. He made more clothes which he sold and made more profits. Since he serviced the loan, he has grown his business and was able to pay school fees for his children.  

He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested another loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is fifty-eight years old, and the single mother of five children aged forty, thirty-six, thirty-two, twenty-eight and twenty-two. She runs a restaurant, a business she started eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase 50kgs of rice, 50kgs of sugar and 50 litres of cooking oil. The profit she earns will be ploughed back into her business as well as used to repay her loan. 

Her dream is to one day be a great entrepreneur as well as to encourage her children to venture into the business world.

loans.use: To purchase a 50kgs of rice, 50kgs of sugar and 50 litres of cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is twenty-nine years old; she lives in a small village with her mother. She has a store where she sells food, various consumer goods and gifts. She has carried out this activity by herself for more than a year and has become well-known in her village as well as nearby ones. The numbers of her regular clients increase every day. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari. With the sales from her business she covers household expenses, and also reinvests some of her profits in the store.

Tamar requested a loan to increase the stock in trade in her store. With the increased stock she will be able to attract new customers. This will expand the sales from her business and she will get increased profit. With the increased amount of profit she will be able to reinvest more in her business and the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to increase the stock in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has three children.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She works hard in her business so as to provide for her family. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

Mary hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 43 years old; he lives in a small village with his family: his wife who is a teacher in the local school and his 21-year-old daughter who is a student. The family earns their living through agricultural business. In particular Vazha has 2 hectare of land where he grows corn and grapes. He has his own mini-bus and along with the agriculture, he provides transportation services to the local population. Vazha is busy during the whole day. He works hard to earn income for living. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Vazha requested a loan for his agricultural business. With this loan he will be able to cultivate the family-owned land and sow corn. He will work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. After selling the corn, the family will get planned income and Vazha will be able to continue financing the eduction of his daughter.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land

loans.name: Sandro

texts.en:
Sandro is forty-four years old; he lives with his wife in a small village of Kakheti Region. For over fifteen years he has been using his own vehicle to offer taxi services for the local population and has acquired extensive experience in this business. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Lari.

Sandro requested a loan to start up an agricultural business. He plans to plant a vineyard. He is a very hard working man and thinks that he will get a good harvest. Sandro will sell part of the harvested product on the local open market, as well as make wine, which will be sold locally as well. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased amount of profit he will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it even more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to start a vineyard business.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is married and has three children.  She runs a green grocery business to earn a living.  She has been in the business for only one year.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy green peppers.

loans.use: To buy green peppers

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old; he lives in a small village with his family: his wife, parents, brother and sister-in-law. The family earns their living through agricultural business. David has several beehives with bee colonies. He makes ecologically clean honey and sells on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Lari. 

David requested a loan to buy five beehives with bee colonies. Also, he plans to buy 1 hectare of land where he hopes to grow vegetables and fruits. As a result of the above-mentioned investment, the income of the family will increase. He will use the big portion of his increased income for reinvesting in agricultural business - buying more bee-hives. Also, as a result of the increased income, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking business lady.  She runs a beauty salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

Victoria hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and hair treatment products.

loans.use: To buy hair braids and hair treatment products

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos ainda frequentando Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É funcionária da Saúde, trabalha como enfermeira, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende apostar mais nas suas capacitações e continuar a melhorar a sua residência, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais. 
O desafio é aumentar o seu nível profissional para poder exercer a sua actividade com eficácia.
texts.en:
Clemencia is married and has two children who are still in school. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She is a healthcare worker who works as a nurse. She intends to use this loan to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, sand, iron and other materials) in order to continue building her house.

In the future Clemencia intends to commit more to her professional development and continue to make improvements to her house. To do so, she promises to pay off this loan on time so she can ask for more loans.

Her challenge is to improve as a professional so she can do her job effectively.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, cement, sand, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais ainda frequentam a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda e produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobilar para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal tenciona pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos de investimento para desenvolver mais o seu negócio e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is married and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are still at School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. 
She has her own business selling a variety of products and with this loan she intends to purchase construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron and others) so she can continue to build her house.

In future she intends to finish the construction of her house and furnish it so that her family is more comfortable. To this end she expects to duly pay off this loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of capital to invest into developing her business and the high cost of living.

loans.use: purchase construction material (sand, cement, stone, iron and others).

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 33 years old. He recently married and lives with his wife, Nina, in the village of Ruisi in East Georgia. 

Kakha and Nina earn an income through the family agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Nina produces cheese and sells this product to local dairy retailers, who buy the products from local farmers and then re-sell them in nearby towns for higher prices. 

Kakha also grows vegetables such as cabbage, garlic, onions and tomatoes on a family-owned 1.5 hectare of land. Kakha works hard on the plot. Sometimes, especially in the spring when there are many agricultural works to be completed, he hires local workers. Kakha sells his harvest to local green-grocery retailers. Also he has a tractor, which is used for agricultural works. He rents the tractor to neighbor farmers and receives additional income in this way. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL. 

Kakha has requested credit to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat his plants for parasites. Also, he will use a small part of the loan to hire local workers, who will help him execute the abovementioned works. 

In the future, Kakha plans to save money so he can invest in agricultural works next year. Additionally, part of the money will be used for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs to treat his plants for parasites.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos todos frequentam a Escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (barrotes, blocos, cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para concluir a sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir um armazém para servir de ferragem onde poderá vender material de construção, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é poder conseguir ter agua canalizada para assegurar que o seu negócio melhore.
texts.en:
Armando is married and is the father of 3 children, who all go to School. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.
With this loan, Armando intends to purchase construction materials (beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron and others) to complete the work on his house.

In future he intends to build a warehouse to serve as a hardware store where he will be able to sell construction material. In order to achieve this he commits to duly paying off this loan so that he is able to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain plumbing and running water to ensure his business will improve.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (beams, blocks, cement, sand, iron and others) to complete the work on his house.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

Gemma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

Gemma has been hog-raising for three years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is married and has ten children. She is 72 years old and resides at Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Miguela owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting corn and coconut for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,700 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2009, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Miguela wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en: Dario is a 52-year-old fisherman from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. He is married and has 10 children. Dario provides for his family through fishing. He works hard to keep up with the increasing needs in his household. He has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will bring in more fish for Dario to sell. Dario hopes for his income to increase and enable him to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Kakhi

texts.en:
Kakhi is a 46-year-old farmer from the village of Dirbi in East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family, including his wife, Dali, two children (ages 13 and 10) and parents. Both children go to school. All adult family members are involved in the family agricultural business, which is the only source of  income for them. 

They have 3 hectares of land, where green beans, maize and apple trees are grown. Kakhi, Dali and Kakhi’s parents are extremely busy in the spring to ensure a good harvest is reaped in the late summer/early fall. After cultivating the land and sowing vegetables, they fertilize and treat the land to protect against parasites. 

Kakhi has a car. He takes harvested apples and vegetables to the open markets of nearby towns for sale. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 GEL.

Kakhi has requested credit to expand the family's agricultural business. He plans to purchase 1 hectare of land for agricultural farming. 

Kakhi will use the land to grow vegetables and increase his harvest. This will increase the income of the family, enabling them to improve their living conditions. Kakhi also hopes that he will be able to save enough money to finance his children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 1 hectare of land for agricultural farming.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child. 

Evelyn has a store that sells a variety of products including soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for sale.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida of Bacolod, Ozamis City has been raising pigs for more than five years and earns PHP 5,000 per month. She is 40 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to provide an adequate life for her six children. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. 

In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she is borrowing PHP 6,400 from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Nida hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is 62 years old. He lives in the village of Ruisi, Kareli District, East Georgia with his family: his wife – Mzia and 26-year-old daughter. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a milk cow, one pig and two piglets in the farm. Mzia produces various dairy products, part of which are consumed in the family. The biggest part of the milk is used for cheese production. The family sells produced cheese in the village to local retailers. 

Bezhan sells on average 10 piglets per year. Along with the farm of domestic animals, Bezhan, Mzia and their daughter are busy on family owned 1.3 hectares of land. They grow cabbages, onions, garlic and raspberries. Harvested products are sold in the village as well, to greengrocery produce retailers, who buy fruits and vegetables from local farmers and re-sell them in nearby towns with a price mark-up. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Bezhan requested credit for financing seasonal agricultural work on family-owned land. In particular, he will purchase fertilizers to fertilize the land and chemicals to treat the plants against parasites. All family members will work hard on the plot, especially in spring and summer, to get a high quality harvest. After selling the produce, the family will get more income than last year. That will allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals to treat the plants against parasites

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old farmer from the village of Karaleti, Gori District. He lives in the village with his wife – Eka and three daughters (19, 14 and 10 years old). His younger daughter goes to school and the elder one helps her parents in the family farm. The family owns 1.4 hectares of land. They grow cabbages, peppers, potatoes, and apple trees on their land. David, Eka and their elder daughter are very busy in the spring season, as they have to complete seasonal work in order to get a quality harvest in late summer. 

David has a car. He takes the harvested produce to the local open market for sale. The family saves some funds received from the sale for financing most of next year's seasonal work and the rest is used for family needs during the year. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris.

David requested credit for purchasing fertilizers and chemicals. He will fertilize the land and use chemicals for prophylactic measures on the plot against parasites. After well completed seasonal work the family can count on a good harvest, which will be sold at a suitable price. The family will get more income and will be able to spend more on satisfying their needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for agricultural plot

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 44 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Gori District of East Georgia. She lives with her family, including her husband, Durmishkhan, and her 21-year-old son. Lali’s son serves in the country’s army. 

Lali and Durmishkhan run the family's agricultural business. They own 1.4 hectares of land, which they use to grow fruits and vegetables. They farm a variety of crops on the land, including cherries, quince, plums, apples, cabbage and green beans. 

Lali and Durmishkhan are especially busy in the spring in order to produce a good harvest in the late summer. They sell the harvested products locally to green-grocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 GEL, including the salary of Lali’s son. 

Lali has requested credit to finance seasonal works on the plot. Specifically, she will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers and seeds. The money will enable Lali to produce a quality harvest, which can be sold for a good price. The profits will be used to finance the family's daily needs, including food and other necessities.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and to purchase fertilizers and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Josefina has been in this business for seven years. Josefina earns additional income from vegetable and egg retail.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her office.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mary con su anterior credikiva compró una vitrina y mercancía, con la cual la surtió;  así mismo compró cervezas, víveres, azúcar y otros productos de la canasta familiar, pues actualmente tiene una tienda ubicada e casa de sus suegros, donde le está yendo muy bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará al por mayor,  artículos de la canasta familiar, para atender la demanda de sus clientes, porque teniendo surtido su negocio, venderá y   continuará aumentando su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Bendiciones para todos y les deseo lo mejor y que algún día me puedan ayudar a adquirir una casa”.
texts.en: Luz Mary bought a display case and merchandise with her previous Kiva loan, which helped her grow.  She also bought beer, food, sugar, and other food basket products.  She has a store located in her in-laws’ home and things are going well for her.  She is asking for a new Kiva loan so she can buy more food products to satisfy her customers’ needs.  Having an assortment allows her to sell more and increase her working capital.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is, “Blessings for all of you and I wish you the best and I hope that someday you can help me buy a house.”

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a 60 year old widow, and a mother of five children. She lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Leonita used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raffia business in the Philippines. Raffia is a soft, natural, palm leaf fiber used for weaving and making baskets. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Doris requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for producing her raffia.

In the future, Doris would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her raffia.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 34 years old and married. She has one child. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Merlinda is borrowing PHP 15,500 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive con su esposa y su hija de preescolar, trabaja en una maquiladora mientras su esposa se encarga las labores del hogar y el cuidado de la pequeña hija.
En el patio trasero tiene una alberca sin acabar de construir, le hace falta muchos detalles, sobre todo el piso, pintura y acabados, algunas tuberias para el agua y los productos para el mantenimiento posterior a esto. El quiere que la familia conviva en un ambiente mas seguro y como beneficio extra un mejor ambiente familiar y en el desarrollo emocional de su hija.
Al estar lista la alberca, la piensa poner en renta y asi darles un mayor ingreso a su familia y dice que tambien la podra disfrutar su hija ya que sera la primera en usarla.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and preschool-aged daughter.  He works in an export factory and his wife cares for the home and their young daughter.

Behind his home there is an incomplete pool the needs lots of work, above all the floor, paint, finishing, and some water and drainage pipes.  He wants his family to have a more secure environment and better family environment for his daughter’s emotional development.

Once the pool is completed, he plans to rent it out and in this way gain greater income for his family.  He also says that his daughter will be able to enjoy it, as she will be the first to use it.

loans.use: to repair his pool.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Dame est un jeune célibataire qui gère une quincaillerie sur la route principale qui traverse sa localité.Il a en charge ses deux parents ainsi que les frais de scolarité de deux de ses frères. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant du ciment et du fer. Son ambition est d'élargir sa quincaillerie.
texts.en: Dame is a young single man who runs a hardware store on the main road that runs through his town. He is supporting his two parents and paying school fees for two of his brothers. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to bolster his working capital by buying cement and iron. His ambition is to enlarge his hardware store.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 38 years-old. She is married and has two children, age 18 and 16.  

In 2001, she established  her cow's-milk-selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and  as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables, fruits, vinegar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Depuis plus de 12 ans, Balla parcours les rues de sa localité pour vendre du café qu'il sert à domicile ou dans les lieux de travail de ses clients. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants. Il vend également de denrées alimentaires dans un magasin qui est géré par un de ses cousins.Ces deux activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, Balla sollicite un pret de 450000f auprès de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter un stock de café en poudre. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente en gros de café en poudre en centre ville.
texts.en:
For more than 12 years now, Balla has been going through the streets of his town selling coffee which he serves to people at their houses or their place of work. He is married and the father of five children. He also sells foodstuffs in a store that is managed by one of his cousins. These two activities allow him to support his family and especially to cover the school fees of his children.

In order to bolster his working capital, Balla is requesting a loan of 450,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy a stock of instant coffee. His ambition is to open a big store wholesaling instant coffee in the center of town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of instant coffee.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 30 años casado, el se dedica al servicio de odontología el es   odontólogo, tiene su consultorio dental que se encuentran en la zona Segundo Crucero  al norte de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Carlos  va a usar este préstamo  para compra de un  equipo de rayos x para equipar su consultorio dental, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la oferta de este equipo  de ocasión, el Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son trasladarse a una zona más comercial y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir equipando su consultorio y así de esta manera incrementar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en: Carlos is 30 years old and married. He makes a living as a dentist and has his dentist practice in the Segundo Crucero area in the north part of La Paz. This is Carlos's second loan cycle with this institution, which he will use to buy X-ray equipment to equip his practice. Carlos is requesting this loan to bid on this used equipment. Carlos is faced with challenges in his business, such as moving to a more commercial area. He is going to use the profits to continue equipping his practice and this way, he will increase attention from his customers.

loans.use: to buy X-ray equipment.

loans.name: Baboucar

texts.fr: Baboucar est un gardien d'un grand immeuble qui appartient à un immigré. Il exerce en même temps un commerce de produits alimentaire. Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des sacs d'oignons.Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: Baboucar works as a guard in a big building that belongs to an immigrant. He also runs a little grocery store. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sacks of onions. His ambition is to get into raising cattle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 40 years-old. She is married and has two children, age 16 and 9.  

In 2000, she established  her cow's-milk-selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk-giving cow.  

In the future, Kamala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for there milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 63 years old and married. She has six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucresia has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from raising ducks and farming rice.

Lucresia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Federita has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Federita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.
