He wants to increase his production, which is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow him to buy corn, bean, and sorghum seeds, plus fertilizer and tools like hoes and machetes for clearing and preparing the land. 

Misael has good recommendations and is financially reliable with immaculate moral character. He is sure that he will be able to make each payment of the debt and also provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, bean, and sorghum seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patric

texts.en:
Patric is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past 6 years, Patric has been working hard to manage his workshop business, which sells refrigerators.

To help expand his business, Patric has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock, like a fridge, for resale. This will help Patric generate greater profits and increase his income. Patric hopes that in the future he will be able to open a bigger workshop.

Patric is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patric who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like a fridge, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past twenty years Grace has worked hard to manage her business selling dry foods like maize and beans.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry foods like maize to sell and will help Grace to generate greater profits. Her ambition is to expand her business.

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dry foods like maize to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 29 years old, married to Daniel, and blessed with three children aged 14, 6, and 4 years respectively. She owns a grocery shop, a business she started five years ago, and earns a monthly income of 14,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She is requesting a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more maize, beans, fruits, and tomatoes to sell. The profit she earns from it will contribute towards her building her own house. 

Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize, beans, fruits, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 29 years old; a resident who permanently lives in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. To generate income, he works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh. His work schedule is from 7 a.m. in the morning until 5 p.m. He earns approximately USD 100 per month by working overtime. In parallel, his wife also works as a garment worker for the same company. This couple has been blessed with two school-age children.

Due to the lack of a vehicle for traveling to work, Sok would like to take out a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle, which provides good transportation services for the family. This loan will help the family reduce their expenses and increase their savings for the future education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy the family's living needs.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy is a 49-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer in the Reussey Keo district since she was single. She is able to earn an income of approximately $1.50 a day from her rice crop-planting business. Her husband is a local farmer. The humble couple has six children; two are married while the remaining four are single.

Some profits in the entire family’s main source come from Luy's children, who are employed in variety of occupations, ranging from domestic garment factory workers to construction workers. Recently, Luy’s motorbike broke down during use. For this matter, Luy has decided to seek a loan of $500 US dollars (USD) from Kiva, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle to replace the broken one. She hopes our lenders won’t reject her second cycle loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Santos Abraham

texts.es: Santos Abraham de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su tía y su hermana; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se siente orgulloso de tener tan grata experiencia ya que le ha ayudado a obtener las mejores cosechas de la zona, comercia solo producto de calidad y a buen precio se ha hecho de mucha clientela y no quiere perderla para eso necesita capital para aumentar la producción y obtener así mejores resultados; Santos es un hombre emprendedor con muchos sueños a  futuro, sabe que el amor a su labor le permitirá llegar al éxito, quiere aumentar su producción para esta siembra pero necesita invertir el doble es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes y abonos; Santos es un hombre conocido por su honradez tiene muy buenas referencias de pago, está seguro que con lo que se produzca podrá saldar el financiamiento, además tiene una tienda que lo respalda económicamente que es atendida por su hermana. Tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Santos Abraham is 25 years old.  He lives with his aunt and his sister.  He grows corn and has dedicated many years to farming.  He is proud of having so much experience because it has helped him obtain the best harvests in the region.  He sells only good quality products and sells them at a good price.  He has many customers and doesn’t want to lose them, and for this reason he needs capital to increase production and thus, obtain better results.  Santos is an entrepreneur with many dreams for the future.  He knows that devotion to his work will permit him to succeed.  He wants to increase production for this sowing time but needs to invest double.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan from Integral which will permit him to purchase corn, fertilizer, and organic compost. Santos is a man known for his integrity and has good payment references.  He is certain that he will yield a good harvest and be able to pay off the loan.  In addition, he has a store that is his financial back-up.  His sister takes care of the store.  He hopes that, in this way, he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer, and organic compost.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 42, a resident of Malaria within Caloocan City. She is married to Arbi, a mechanic. She has three children, two of whom are in college and one in high school. Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store, or sari-sari, is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lorna profits by buying supplies at wholesale, then selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house.

Lorna also operates a beauty parlor where customers can have their hair styled or nails done. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Lorna also does direct sales. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations, Lorna is requesting a 37,000 PHP loan from CCT to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her sari-sari’s inventory. She will also use a part of the loan to buy a hair dryer, a foot spa, a hydraulic chair, and other hair treatments. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of fifteen to thirty individuals who meet on a weekly basis. There they study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Lorna faithfully meets up with her group to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

loans.use: To pay for products needed in her business.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 25 years old, married to Elkana, and blessed with a nine-year-old child. She owns a boutique, a business she has been doing for the past three years. 

She wants to purchase jeans wear and ladies shoes for sale in her boutique and has requested a first loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). The profit from this business will help her invest in other businesses. 

Her dream is to purchase land and build her own home.

loans.use: To purchase jeans wear and ladies shoes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 32 años de edad y habita en  casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de la tierra principalmente de frijoles y maíz, ya que son los granos básicos que se cosechan en la  zona donde habita. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos como un hombre trabajador y responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él, ya que gracias a su generosidad y carisma se ha ganado la confianza de sus vecinos. Es muy importante mencionar que vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia.  Esta situación le da más fuerzas para trabajar ya que él es el único que trabaja y recibe un poco de ingresos con la venta de una parte de su cosecha. Considera que es conveniente solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. Para comenzar la siembra  de los granos básicos y poder continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar, además esta seguro que podrá con las ganancias de su cosecha pagar éste financiamiento
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He works in farming, mainly beans and corn, as these are the basic grains that are harvested in the area where he lives.  He is very well-known among his neighbors for being a hard-working and responsible man.  Many people give good references regarding him, as thanks to his generosity and charisma he has gained his neighbors' trust.

It is very important to mention that he and his family live in very humble conditions.  This situation gives him more strength to work, as he is the only one working and he earns little income from selling part of his harvest.

He considers it convenient to request this loan from INTEGRAL which will help to cover his expenses in purchasing necessary agricultural supplies such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc., With these he can start sowing these basic grains and be able to continue providing sustenance for his household.  He is also sure that he will be able to pay back this loan with the earnings from his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús ha trabajado toda su vida para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Ella habita junto con sus dos hijas y un hijo.  Gracias al apoyo y educación que ha brindado a sus hijos, ahora los tres son personas de provecho y trabajan duramente par ir paliando la situación económica que cada día es más difícil. En vista a que la situación económica era tan difícil y ella ha sido el sostén del hogar durante mucho tiempo, hace muchos años decidió comenzar con un pequeño bazar en su hogar de habitación, el cual vende variedad de artículos como: palería, juguetes, ropa para bebes, etc. Este ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos que por muchos años le permitió llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Cabe mencionar que aunque ahora sus hijos colaboran con los gastos del hogar, no quiere dejar a un lado su negocio, ya que ella es una mujer trabajadora la cual a pesar de sus 67 años, no se cansa de trabajar y no ha pensado dejar de recibir los ingresos de su bazar. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: variedad de juguetes, ropa para bebes, cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, pega, papel, etc. Con lo cual sueña darle un impulso a su negocio y continuar recibiendo los beneficios que hasta el momento le han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Jesús has worked all her life to be able to take care of her family. She lives with her two daughters and her son. Thanks to the support and upbringing which she has given her children, all three are now hardworking people who work hard to alleviate the economic situation which becomes ever more difficult. In view of the fact that the economic situation was so difficult and that she had been the sole breadwinner for a long time, she decided many years ago to start up a small bazaar in her home, where she sells a variety of items such as stationery, toys, baby clothes, etc. This has been her main source of income which has allowed her to feed her family every day for many years. Despite the fact that her children now contribute to the household expenses she doesn't want to give up her business, as she is a hardworking woman who in spite of her 67 years does not tire of working and who has not considered giving up the income from her bazaar. She is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying merchandise such as a variety of toys, baby clothes, notebooks, pencils, pens, glue, paper, etc. With this, she hopes to boost her business and continue making the profits which have helped her to support her family until now.

loans.use: to buy a variety of toys, baby clothes, notebooks, pencils, pens, glue, paper, etc.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Los deseos  de superación,  hicieron que  Reyna Isabel, de 33 años de edad, entrará al mundo de los negocios. Hace 5 años se decidió en comenzar  una pequeña tienda en la sala de su hogar, en la cual vende variedad de artículos como: cereales, golosinas, detergentes, bebidas, etc. además de su tienda también posee una pequeña pupuseria la cual atiende junto con su cuñada la cual forma parte de su grupo familiar junto con sus dos pequeños hijos y un hermano. Desde hace algunos años ha trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera y no  cuenta con la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. Es una mujer con mucho coraje, la cual tiene muchos deseos de superación,  su mayor sueño es dar a sus hijos una calidad de vida diferente a la que ella ha tenido acceso, está segura que con la ayuda que ahora   solicita a INTEGRAL para impulsar su negocio, podrá  lograr su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia,  ya que la situación es muy difícil y sabe que la única forma de cambiar su realidad es trabajando muy duro. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra principalmente de: bebidas y granos básicos, ya que ha notado un aumento en la demanda de estos productos, y como toda una mujer emprendedora no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad. Es muy importante mencionar, que está muy agradecida con la ayuda que recibió de esta institución, cuando,  al igual que en esta ocasión necesitó de alguien que le tendiera una  mano.
texts.en: The desire to succeed made 33 year old Reyna Isabel enter the business world. Three years ago she decided to start a little store in the living room of her home, where she sells a variety of goods such as: grains, candies, detergents, drinks, etc. In addition to her store, she has a little pupusa stand which she runs with her sister-in-law who is part of her family group along with her two little children and her brother. For some years, she has worked very hard to raise her family as she is a single mother and does not have the support of her children's father. She is a courageous woman who has a lot of will to succeed. Her greatest dream is to give her children a different quality of life to the one she has experienced. It is certain that, with the help that she is requesting now from Integral to boost her business, she will be able to achieve her dream of improving her quality of life and that of her family, although the situation is very difficult and and she knows that the only way to change her reality is to work very hard. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy mostly: drinks and staple grains as she has noted an increase in demand for these products. As an enterprising woman, she doesn't want to let this opportunity slip by. It is very important to mention that she is very grateful for the help that she has received from this institution when, as in this case, she needed someone to lend her a hand.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is an 18-year-old single Lebanese man living with his parents and five siblings. Four of them are working. His father is the only other source of income in the family and taking on his own all expenses and responsibilities. Kassem owns a poultry shop. He is well known for his generosity and good quality. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator and a freezer.This will allow him to increase his food inventory and keep them in good conditions. In the future, he seeks to open his own snack shop.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator and a freezer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Thirty-six year old Ruth is married to Albert and blessed with three children aged 15, 11, and one year. She owns a boutique--a business that she started three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

She has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase women's suits, shoes, and handbags to sell. The profit earned from her business will help her invest into another line of business. 

Her dream is to become a prominent business lady in town as well as to provide her family with a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase more women's suits, shoes, and handbags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is 45 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Jesse has been working hard to manage his butchery, which sells fresh meat.

To help expand his business, Jesse has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for the butchery, and will help Jesse to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Jesse hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children up to university. 

Jesse is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jesse who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for his butchery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell and to pay for gasoline for their motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Etbel Jeannette

texts.es: Etbel Jeannethe de 42 años de edad, habita junto con su esposo  de 42 años de edad y sus dos hijos de 18 y 12 años,  el menor se encuentra estudiando.  La señora Etbel se dedica al comercio de de tienda desde hace dieciocho años y medio. Gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerlo activo y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de las principales necesidades, las cuales cada vez son mayores. Es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su servicio. En cuanto a la estabilidad del negocio, tiene mucha ventaja ya que no cuenta con mayor competencia lo cual la convierte en una de las preferidas de la zona ya que es una de las tiendas mas surtidas en la cual las personas encuentran buen servicio y variedad de productos en muy buenas condiciones.   Últimamente ha estado notando que la demanda de  los productos esta aumentando y muchas veces se queda escasa de producto. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos  (frijoles, azúcar, arroz, golosinas, pan, aceite, champo, jabón, papel, etc.) que le permitan cubrir una mayor demanda y de esta manera espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. cabe mencionar que esta muy agradecida con la ayuda que esta institución le brindo en el pasado.
texts.en: 42 year old Etbel Jeannethe lives with her 42 year old husband and their two children who are 18 and 12 years old. The youngest child is in school. Etbel works in running a grocery store and she has been doing this for 18 and a half years. Thanks to God and her hard work, she has been able to sustain this activity and this is what enables her to put bread on the table every day as her husband's income is not enough to pay for the main necessities, which are always becoming more expensive. She is well known in the area as she always offers quality products and good prices. For her, the most important thing is that her customers are satisfied with her service. Regarding the stability of her business, she has a big advantage as there is no real competition because she has become one of the preferred stores in the area as the store is well supplied and people can get good service there as well as a variety of products in good condition. Lately she has been noting that the demand for her products is increasing and she is often left with a scarcity of goods. This has led her to take the decision to request a loan from Integral to invest in her business by buying supplies (beans, sugar, rice, candy, bread, oil, shampoo, soap, paper, etc.) that will enable her to meet a greater demand and, in this way, she hopes to make better profits that will enable here to improve the quality of life for her and her family. It must be mentioned that she is very grateful for the help that this institution has offered her in the past.

loans.use: to buy: beans, sugar, rice, candy, bread, oil, shampoo, soap, paper, etc.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is 38 years old and a widow with four children aged between nine and 20 years. She owns a retail shop which brings in a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has been in this business for four years now. 

This is her second loan of KES 10,000 with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her first loan. She will be using the loan to purchase more stocks of cooking fat, sugar, and rice for her business. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to invest in it. Her dream is to open a saloon business to increase her income so as to be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cooking fat, sugar, and rice for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Yanira Guadalupe

texts.es: Yanira Guadalupe  de 44 años de edad, habita junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Gracias a la educación que con mucho empeño dio a sus hijos, estos ahora ya se encuentran trabajando y ya ayudan un poco con la economía del hogar. La señora Yanira se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería desde hace 11 años. Todos los días se levanta  muy temprano para ocuparse de las tareas del hogar y luego trasladarse para el lugar donde vende sus billetes de lotería. Se establece en un lugar muy concurrido en el cual ya logro ganarse la confianza de muchas personas, razón por la cual ya cuenta con clientela que continuamente la buscan para demandar los billetes de lotería. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad y  de los pocos ingresos  recibidos por su esposo en el oficio de fontanería, han logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Aunque ahora sus  hijos ya están trabajando y colaboran en el hogar, no quieren quedarse de brazos cruzados, sin hacer nada. Ellos son personas trabajadoras que les gusta salir adelante por medio de sus propios esfuerzos. Esta razón ha llevado a la señora Yanira a presentarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito el cual le permita adquirir un número mayor de billetes de lotería para incrementar la oferta y poder lograr incrementar las ventas así como los ingresos. De esta forma espera mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: 44 year old Yanira Guadalupe lives with her family group, which is comprised of her husband and 3 children. Thanks to the education that she has, with much dedication, given to her children, they have already found work and they help a little with the household expenses. Yanira has been selling lottery tickets for 11 years. Every morning, she gets up very early to do the housework and later she goes to the place where she sells lottery tickets. She has a location that is very busy and she has won the confidence of many people and so she has customers who always look for her to buy lottery tickets. With the income that she gets from this work, and with the little income received by her husband as a plumber, they have been able to bring up their family. Although her children are now in work and help at home, they don't want to sit with their arms crossed, not doing anything. They are hardworking people who like to succeed through their own efforts.  This has led Yanira to present herself at this institution to request this loan which will enable her to acquire a greater number of lottery tickets to increase her stock and to be able to increase her sales and, therefore, her income. In this way, she hopes to improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijas de 18, 16 y 12 años de edad.  Su esposo se dedica al oficio de sastre y sus hijas se encuentran estudiando. Como toda mujer emprendedora decidió comenzar con la venta de alimentos en su hogar de residencia. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y lo mejor de todo con algunos clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su deseo es terminar de dar los estudios a sus hijas y poder verlas como profesionales con mejores oportunidades a las que ella y su esposo han tenido. Con el fin de abarcar  una mayor demanda de mercado y mejorar sus ganancias,  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (verduras, carne, pollo, arroz, maíz, frijoles, huevos, etc.) para preparar variedad de ricos platillos que le permitan atraer a más clientes y que le ayudan a lograr su objetivo. Confía que con la ayuda de esta institución y con su dedicación a su negocio logrará resultados positivos que le permitirán mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y continuar ayudando a sus hijas con el estudio.
texts.en:
uana is 39 years old.  She lives in her own home with her life companion and her three children, ages 18, 16, and 12.  Her husband is a tailor and her children are students.  Like all women entrepreneurs, she decided to start selling food from her home.  She has been engaged in this activity for many years and so already has plenty of experience.  Best of all, she has many regular customers that prefer her more and more each day because she is enterprising, responsible, and hard-working.  She wishes to see her children complete their studies and become professionals so that they may have better opportunities than she and her husband have had. 

With the intention of taking on higher market demand and improving profits, she decided to request this loan from Integral to invest in her business. She will purchase needed supplies (vegetables, meat, chicken, rice, corn, beans, eggs, etc.) to prepare a variety of delicious dishes which will attract more customers and help her achieve her goal.  She is confident that with the help of this institution and with her dedication to her business, she will achieve positive results that will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions and continue helping her children with their studies

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, rice, corn, beans, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Moeng

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Moeng operates a hog-raising business to help her husband generate income. She is 50 years old and has eight children; six are married and two are single. Her husband manages their rice farming business to provide income for the family. Together, they are able to earn approximately $6.00 US dollars (USD) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Moeng is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Cambodia riels (KHR) to supplement her savings, which will be used to purchase construction materials to renovate her house. With the help of this loan, she has enough capital to fix her house and make a comfortable living for the whole family. In the future, she plans to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Alberto Ulises

texts.es: Alberto Ulises de 36 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz en la zona donde habita junto a su familia.  Tiene muchos años de realizar esta actividad ya que es su principal fuete de ingresos y de esta forma es como ha llevado el sustento a su hogar.  Al igual que él, su esposa también se preocupa por apoyar con la economía del hogar, por lo que desde hace varios años  se decidió en colocar una tortillería en su hogar de residencia, de este negocio logra  percibir  un poco de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de su familia que cada día son mayores. Es una familia muy unida, la cual es muy conocida en la zona donde habitan. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias del trabajo, tanto del señor Alberto como del trabajo de su esposa, ya que son personas trabajadoras, honestas, responsables y generosas.  Con muchos deseos de superación Alberto ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un credito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas,  fertilizantes, etc. para comenzar la siembra ya que la temporada ya se hizo presente por lo que no puede esperar mucho tiempo para dar inicio a esta actividad, que es muy importante para la subsistencia de él y de  su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is 36 years old, and lives with his wife and children in their own house. He makes a living farming corn near his home, and has been working as a farmer for many years now. His crops are his main source of income and means to provide for his family. His wife also works hard to provide for their family, and she operates a tortilla making business out of their home. This activity allows her to generate some income to help with their ever-increasing household expenses. They are a very tight-knit family and are known in their area for being very close. 

Many people speak well of the work that Alberto and his wife do, as they are very hard-working, honest, responsible and generous people. With the future and hopes for business growth in mind, Alberto has decided to request this loan, which will allow him to purchase various agricultural inputs, including: manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. He needs these products in order to start the planting season, which is coming up soon. His farming and agricultural endeavors are very important for his family’s well being.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Elsa Gladis

texts.es: Elsa Gladis, no logro terminar sus estudios por lo que decidió dedicarse al mundo de los negocios. Comenzó con la venta de pan dulce en el interior de su hogar. Por el momento el negocio se encuentra en marcha y vende otros productos como: frijoles, plátanos y  de más artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. La señora Elsa habita junto a su hija de 18 años, en casa de su propiedad la cual se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida. Esto ha permitido que el negocio de Elsa sea muy conocido y frecuentado por muchas personas ya que se encuentra en una zona muy estratégica y de fácil acceso. Lleva muchos años dedicándose al negocio. Gracias a su dedicación y disciplina ha logrado mantenerlo activo y pretende que éste se convierta en una tienda; sueña con seguir persiguiendo los ingresos de su negocio por mucho más tiempo dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ella  es una mujer ejemplar, ya que  sóla ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija y sigue trabajando para darle lo mejor. Todo esto la motiva a continuar trabajando. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio para lo cual necesita la ayuda de un préstamo, el cual solicita a esta institución, INTEGRAL. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (harina, azúcar, huevos, colorantes, leche, canela, etc.) para la elaboración del delicioso pan que cada día sus clientes le demandan. Confía que logrará resultados favorables los cuales le permitan optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsa Gladis was not able to finish her education so she decided to dedicate herself to the world of business. She began by selling tea-breads from her home. At the moment, the business is expanding and she sells other goods like: beans, bananas, and other items that are attractive to her customers. Elsa lives with her 18 year old daughter in her own home which is in a very busy area. This has enabled Elsa's business to be very well known and frequented by many people as it is strategically located in the area and easy to get to. She has been running this business for many years. Thanks to her dedication and discipline, she has been able to maintain her business and she intends that it will become more of a store. She hopes that she will continue to draw income from this business for a long time as it is her main source of income. She is an exemplary woman as she has been able to raise her daughter alone and to continue working so that she can give her the best. All this motivates her to continue working. She has taken the decision to invest in her business and this is why she needs the loan which she is requesting from the institution Integral. The loan will be used to buy raw materials (flour, sugar, eggs, coloring, milk, cinnamon, etc.) for making the delicious bread that her customers demand every day. She is confident that she will have favorable results that will enable her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy: flour, sugar, eggs, coloring, milk, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 40 years of age. She is married to her husband Suleiman, who also contributes in providing for the family's needs. They are blessed with six children aged between 7 and 20 years. Pamela runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, with a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

This is Pamela’s second loan of 40,000 KES after successfully repaying her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the borrowed loan to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking fat, and rice for resale.

With the anticipated profits from her business, Pamela plans to invest some amount in her retail business and use the remaining amount to pay her childrens' school fees.  Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful business woman with lots of business ventures.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, cooking fat, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena tiene 7 años de dedicarse al negocio de  elaboración y venta de deliciosos pasteles, los cuales elabora en su hogar de residencia.  En el pasado hacía la venta de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas donde ella habita. Gracias a su esfuerzos y trabajo ha logrado acomodar su negocio en su hogar de residencia, el cual es muy visitado por muchas personas dado que la señora Carmen se caracteriza por ser la líder en la venta de  deliciosos pasteles del vecindario.  Tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa alquilada junto con su hija, la cual se encuentra estudiando. El sueño de Carmen es terminar de financiar los estudios de su hija para que pronto pueda optar a un empleo, con el cual pueda tener acceso a mejores condiciones de vida. Dado que las exigencias económicas de su hija han aumentado y no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos con la cual pueda hacerles frente, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar esté crédito a INTEGRAL con el cual pueda adquirir los insumos necesarios como: harinas, huevos, azúcar, fruta, etc. para la elaboración de los deliciosos pasteles que tanto le demandan sus clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar sus ganancias que le permitan dar a su hija lo necesario para cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en: For 7 years, Carmen Elen has been running her business making and selling delicious cakes which she makes in her kitchen. In the past, she sold her cakes in the street in the different areas where she lived. Thanks to her efforts and work, she has been able to accommodate her business in her home, which is visited by many people because she is the neighborhood leader in selling delicious cakes. She is 54 years old and lives in a rented house with her daughter who is in school. Carmen's dream is to finish paying for her daughter's education so that she can quickly find work so that she will be able to have a better quality of life. Because her daughter's financial needs have increased and she doesn't have another source of income with which to cover them, she has decided to take out a loan from Integral that will enable her to buy necessary supplies such as: flour, eggs, sugar, fruit, etc to make the delicious cakes that her customers demand. She does all this with the goal of improving her income that enables her to give her daughter what she needs to cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de kuña katupyry está en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres de la fundación Paraguaya. Ellas tienen cada una un trabajo independiente, pero también realizan trabajo juntas con lo cual fomentan el trabajo en equipo de ellas.
La señora Basilica es una miembro del grupo, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha podido ir creciendo y ayudando a sus familiares y de esa forma darles para el día a dúia. Ella se dedica a la costura y comenta que tiene siempre muchos pedidos y gracias a Dios no le falta trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de gomas, telas, hilos, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene, ya que esta con mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” committee is in its second cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s women’s program.  Each of them has her own occupation but they also do joint projects to encourage teamwork among them.

Basilica is a group member.  She comments that thanks to her work and sacrifice she’s managed to grow and help her family thus providing for them day to day.  She is a seamstress and she comments that she always has many orders and thanks be to God she does not lack work. Her goal is to be able to continue working to help her family by this means.

She’s asking for the loan to buy glue, fabric, thread and other supplies to continue working and to be able to fill all her pending orders since she has a lot of work to do.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es: Maritza Guadalupe de treinta y seis años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia; ella posee un chalet en una escuela cercana a la localidad donde reside ahí vende papas, tortas, panes, golosinas, bebidas entre otros,  es una comida muy rica y todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por su buen servicio y amabilidad; Maritza es un ejemplo a seguir una mujer dedicada al trabajo dispuesta a superarse para alcanzar un futuro más próspero, su más grande sueño es alcanzar el éxito y se está esforzando mucho para poder lograrlo, este año escolar ha subido la demanda y Maritza quiere surtir el negocio para no decepcionar a su clientela pero no posee de capital suficiente y quiere realizar todas las compras al contado es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, frijoles, embutidos, golosinas, bebida, y mantenimiento del local etc. Maritza tiene un buen comportamiento crediticio y puede asegurar que cancelará ese financiamiento en la fecha establecida y al mismo tiempo llevará a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en: Maritza Guadalupe is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her two children in her own home.  She owns an eatery in a school near the town where she lives and there, she sells potatoes, cakes, bread, candy, beverages, and other items. The meals are very delicious and everything she sells is first class quality and available at affordable prices.  In addition, she is known for her good service and friendliness.  Maritza is a role model, a woman dedicated to her work and willing to go the extra mile to achieve a more prosperous future.  Her greatest dream is to be successful and she is making a great effort to achieve this goal.  Demand for this school year has increased and Maritza wants to stock her business so that she won’t disappoint her customers.  However, she doesn’t have enough capital and wants to make all of her purchases in cash.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase bread, beans, sausage, candy, and beverages, and to maintain her eatery.  Maritza has a good credit performance and guarantees that she will pay off this loan by the established date and at the same time, she will bring financial security to her home and have a full life.

loans.use: to purchase bread, beans, sausages, candy, and beverages.

loans.name: Marilin De Jesus

texts.es: Marilin de Jesús de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella  posee un comedor donde vende desayunos y almuerzos unos platillos exquisitos, huevos, plátanos, pollo, carne, ensaladas, arroz, sopa, entre otros, esta ubicado en la calle cerca de una zona industrial, los trabajadores de esa zona son sus mejores clientes y la prefirieren porque sus comidas son de excelente calidad, con rico sabor, higiénicas y a un excelente precio además de un servicio especial; Marilin es una mujer emprendedora con un gran don para la cocina, quiere aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le presenta, piensa que su más grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la perseverancia; cada día la demanda aumenta más en el negocio y Marilin tiene que aumentar la producción para no decepcionar a su clientela pero necesita de más capital porque no le alcanza, por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, verduras, granos básicos, frutas, etc. Ella ha demostrado un buen record de paga y la capacidad económica para afrontar la deuda, al mismo tiempo tiene la seguridad que las ganancias le permitirán ofrecerle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marilin de Jesús, 38, lives with her life partner in their own house.  She has an eatery where she sells breakfasts and lunches, delicious dishes with eggs, bananas, chicken, meat, salad, rice and soup among others.  It’s located on the street near an industrial zone and workers in the area are her best customers and prefer her dishes because they are of excellent quality, delicious and at an excellent price in addition to  the special service.  

Marilin is an enterprising woman with a great gift for cooking.  She wants to take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself.  She believes that her greatest secret of success is perseverance.  Every day demand increases in her business and Marilin has to increase production in order not to disappoint her clientele but she needs more capital because she does not have enough.  This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy meat, cured meats, dairy products, vegetables, basic grains, fruit, etc.

She has established a good payment history and economic capacity to take on this debt.  At the same time she is sure that profits will allow her to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, cured meats, dairy products, vegetables, basic grains and fruit.

loans.name: Jose Obdulio

texts.es: José Obdulio de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su familia, él es jardinero y tiene un sueldo fijo que le ayuda a llevar los gastos del hogar, vive en una zona muy agradable y humilde, desde hace algún tiempo su casa empezó a tener algunos desperfectos, deterioros en el techo, polines, entre otros pero ahora que se han presentado las lluvias necesita reparar urgentemente el techo, pero necesita de capital para realizarlo por eso se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, madera, herramientas etc., para cambiar por completo el techo; José es un hombre muy trabajador, enérgico, siempre está buscando salir adelante para obtener un futuro mejor, piensa que hay que ser dueños y herederos de nuestros sueños para nunca dejarlos ir, José Obdulio es honesto y muy responsable con excelentes referencias y solvencia para poder saldar el financiamiento, además  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrán mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
José Obdulio, 38, lives with his family.  He’s a gardener and earns a steady salary that helps him cover household expenses.  He lives in a very pleasant, humble zone.  

For some time now his house has started to show some wear and tear; there are problems with the roof and beams, among others.  But now that the rains have come he urgently needs to fix the roof but needs capital to do so and this is why he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy roofing tiles, lumber, tools, etc. to completely replace the roof.  

José is a hardworking, energetic man who is always looking to get ahead in order to have a better future.  He believes that one must own and be heirs to our dreams and never let them go.

José Obdulio is honest and very responsible with excellent references and solvency to repay the loan.  In addition, he hopes that he will be able to improve quality of life at home this way.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe tiene 36 años de edad y habita junto a su familia la cual está constituida por su hijo de 18 años, su nuera de 19 años y su pequeño nieto de 2 meses de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de variedad de prendas de vestir para todos los gustos y  preferencias.  Además de ropa también vende accesorios de belleza. Su venta la hace de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de la ciudad donde vive. Dichas zonas son muy transitadas y concurridas  ya que se encuentran en el centro. Posee mucha experiencia en el área y ha logrado ganarse  la confianza de muchas personas que cada día la prefieren más.  Tiene algunos clientes fijos a los cueles les deja mercadería para que ellos puedan hacer la reventa.  La señora Morena es muy trabajadora y comprometida con su familia dado que para ella es su principal fuente de inspiración para continuar trabajando. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para impulsar su negocio ya que quiere tener la capacidad de abarcar una mayor demanda de mercado con la cual pueda mejorar sus ganancias. Y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de: ropa para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y accesorios de belleza ya que es lo que más se vende. Confía que de esta forma logrará alcanzar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe, 36, lives with her family consisting of her 18-year-old son, her 19-year-old daughter-in-law and her little 2-month-old grandson.  She sells a variety of articles of clothing for all tastes and preferences.  In addition to clothes she also sells beauty accessories.  She sells from place to place in the main zones of the city where she lives.  Said zones are very busy and have many passersby because they are downtown.  She has much experience in this line of work and has managed to win over the trust of many people who prefer her more every day.  She has some regular customers that she leaves merchandise with for them to resell.

Morena is very hardworking and committed to her family since they are her main inspiration for continuing to work.  She’s asking INTEGRAL for this loan to push her business forward because she wants to have the capacity to encompass a larger market share to improve her profits and as a result her and her family’s quality of life.

She will use the loan to buy women’s clothes, men’s clothes, children’s clothes and beauty accessories which are what sell the most.  She trusts that she will reach her objective this way.

loans.use: to buy clothes and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara Luz de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive juntos a su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de carne, pollo, frutas y verduras como tomates, cebollas, manzanas, melones, entre otros, en un puesto cerca de donde reside, tiene varios años de tener este pequeño negocio y le deja muy buenas ganancias, posee mucha clientela fija de todos los alrededores pues la prefieren por su excelente servicio, calidad en los productos pero sobre todo por los precios accesibles; Clara es una mujer luchadora entregada a su trabajo, tiene muchas metas que quiere alcanzar y sabe que si pone todo su esfuerzo y dedicación podrá llegar a concretarlas, en los últimos meses tuvo una baja en sus ganancias por falta de inversión, debido a que tuvo emergencias económicas que cubrir en su hogar; esta con toda la disposición de recuperarse pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pollo, carne, frutas y verduras por mayor. Clara luz tiene referencias de ser honrada y con una moral impecable está segura que con este apoyo saldrá adelante y podrá cancelar la deuda, además recibe el respaldo de su esposo que es agricultor, tiene la confianza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Clara Luz, age 42, lives with her life partner and her daughter. Clara Luz sells meat, chicken, fruit and vegetables like onions, apples, and melons, among others.  She sells from a stand that is close to where she lives.

She has had this small business for several years, and it gives her good income.  She has a lot of fixed clientele from the surrounding areas.  They prefer her for her excellent service, the quality of the products, and especially for the accessible prices.

Clara is a tenacious woman who is devoted to her work.  She has a lot of goals that she wants to achieve.  She knows that if she puts forth all of her effort and dedication she will be able to reach her goals.  In recent months her income decreased due to lack of investment because she had to cover financial emergencies at home.  

She is extremely eager to recover, but she needs capital.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.   A loan would allow her to buy chicken, meat, fruit, and vegetables wholesale.

Clara Luz has references for being honorable with an impeccable moral character.  She is sure that, with this help, she will get ahead and be able to cancel the debt.   She also has the support of her husband, a farmer.  She is confident that she will be able to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, fruit, and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda del Carmen de 46 años de edad, habita junto a sus dos hijas,  los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio de variedad de frutas y verduras en el mercado Central de la zona donde habita. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 14 años, razón por la cual ya posee algunos clientes fijos. Trabaja muy duro para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su familia dado que para ella es muy importante que puedan tener lo necesario y que algún día sus hijas puedan graduarse de la universidad y logren tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.   Por el momento no le queda más que continuar trabajando para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Solicita este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras al por mayor ya que desea surtir su negocio para atraer a más clientes que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado recibió ayuda cuando mas lo necesito y así su negocio ha ido creciendo, tiene la certeza que con sus ganancias cancelará al día las cuotas que se asignen por éste financiamiento
texts.en: Yolanda del Carmen, 46, lives with her 2 daughters, who are in school.  She has a business selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the central market in the neighborhood where she lives.  She has been doing this work for 14 years, and so she has regular customers.  She works very hard to provide the daily necessities to her family, given that for her, the most important thing is that they have everything they need so that one day her daughters can graduate from the university and manage to have a better quality of life.  For now, she must continue working to support her household.  She is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables at wholesale, because she wants to stock up her business so that she can attract more customers.  This will allow her to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She states that she is very grateful to this institution, because in the past she received help when she needed it the most, and as a result her business has been growing.  She is sure that her earnings will be sufficient to pay off the loan by the due date.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables, such as: yuccas, lemons, beans, potatoes, tomatoes, pinapples, watermelons, melons, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Nakiengtaore Homme Group

texts.fr:
Mr HALIDOU est la responsable du groupe  NAKIENG TAORE HOMME. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 va à l’école .Il a 03 personnes en charge.

Mr est teinturier de pagne traditionnel  depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les grossistes.

Il veut s’acheter 02 barriques de teinture. 

Mr désire utiliser les bénéfices du prêt  pour agrandir son commerce. Il ambitionne  amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Halidou is the leader of the NAKIENG TAORE HOMME group.  He is married and the father of two children, ages 7 and 3.  One of his children attends school.  He has three people in his care.

Halidou has been dyeing traditional pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) for the past 15 years.  He buys his supplies at the market of Secteur 10 in town, and sells to wholesalers.  

He wants to buy two barrels of dye.

Halidou would like to use the profits from his loan to expand his business.  His ambition is to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 barrels of dye.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and married with three children. 

Jocelyn plants and harvests bananas for sale to earn a living, and she has been in this type of business for three years. Each month, she is able to earn revenue in the amount of PHP 3,500. She requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She hopes to expand her business to earn supplementary revenue for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Andrés De Jesús

texts.es: Andrés de Jesús es un hombre  impresionante, dado que a sus 37 años cuenta con una panadería en la cual emplea a 5 personas en la elaboración y venta de pan francés. Vive en casa alquilada junto a su compañera de vida de 30 años y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con algunos clientes fijos que cada día lo prefieren más. Su esposa se encarga de las tareas del hogar por lo que él es el único que cuenta con un trabajo por el cual recibe un ingreso. Todo esto la hace sentirse más comprometido con su negocio dado que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Es muy importante para él mantener su negocio activo y seguir contando con los clientes que posee y atraer a nuevos que le permitan mejorar sus ingresos. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra en una las calles principales a la cual muchas personas tienen acceso. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de materia prima (harina) para la elaboración del pan y para completar el dinero en la compra de un carro el cual le sirva para hacer el recorrido cuando entrega y vende el pan en las diferentes zonas. Confía en Dios que tendrá los resultados que espera.
texts.en:
Andrés de Jesús is an impressive man in that at the age of 37 he has a bakery where he employs five people making French bread to sell.  He lives in a rented house with his life companion, 30, and their two children who are 7 and 2 years old.  

He’s been in this occupation for a long time so he already has regular customers that prefer him more each day.  His wife does the household chores and he’s the only one who has an income-producing job.  All of this makes him feel even more committed to his business since he has no other source of income.  It’s very important for him to keep the business active and to continue to retain the customers he already has as well as to attract new ones to improve his income.  The business’ location is very strategic since it’s located on one of the main streets that many people have access to.  

He’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for this loan to buy raw materials (flour) for making bread and to make up the difference in the money he has to buy a car that will serve to cover his delivery route when he delivers and sells bread in various zones.  He trusts in God that he will get the results he hopes for.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 58, has been an experienced woman in cultivating and harvesting rice crops in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. 

She has tried hard in her business in order to raise her five children since she became a single mother. In order to help her, as well as the family, two of her daughters decided to work as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city.

With the loan she has requested from HKL, a Kiva partner, Chan would like to pay for the process of planting her rice crops this season. Through this investment, she hopes that she can increase her rice production, as well as her income, to meet the needs of the family. She is confident she will pay her loan back to her lenders as it is now her fifth cycle loan.

loans.use: to pay for the process of planting her rice crops this season.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in the Philippines. 

Evangeline used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/mht Group

texts.fr:
Paul fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe/Mht . Le nom du groupe signifie «c’est qui se mit ensemble». Il a 48 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 9 ans à 21 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Paul est agriculteur du riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture du riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants et payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Paul is a member of the Abishyizehamwe/Mht group.  The name of the group means "which has come together".  He is 48 years old, married, and has five children ages 9 to 21, four of whom are attending school.  His education level is five years of primary school.

Paul is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  

He will use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor on his rice fields.

In order to expand his rice farming business, Paul is planning to request other loans.  In the coming years he would like to increase the size of his rice fields in order to meet the demand from the markets.  With his profits, he is planning to pay his children's school fees and to cover his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas es el grupo formado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras de la ciudad de Luque. Ellas vieron una gran oporunidad de crecieminento para ella y sus amigas, desean poder luchar dia a dia y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es soltera, es mama de una nena de 8 años, por quien ella lucha tenazmente ya que quiere darle un buen futuro y un estilo de vida diferente al que le toco vivir. Ella es cocinera Trabajaba como chef en un restoran español. Despues de mucho trabajo logro juntar su dinero y con la ayuda de un prestamo de la fundacion paraguaya logró abrir su propio copetin donde vende las comidas que ella misma prepara. Su sueño es poder tener un gran restaurant que le ayudara  a mejorar el estilo de vida de ella y su familia.
Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, carnes, condimentos, huevos, penificados, verduras y demás insumos con los que podrá elaborar los alimentos que vende. Agradece a la fundacion paraguaya por la oportunidad que nuevamente esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Activas" ["Active Women"] is the group formed by 15 very hard-working and enterprising women of the city of Luque. They saw a great opportunity for growth for themselves and their friends, and they want to be able to work hard day by day so that they can help their families. 

Maria is single, and she is the mother of a little girl, 8 years old, for whom she works tenaciously, since she wants to give her a good future and a standard of living different from the one she grew up with. She is a cook, and she previously worked as a chef in a Spanish restaurant. After much work she succeeded in saving her money, and with the help of a loan from the Paraguaya Foundation, she was able to open her own snack bar, where she sells food that she prepares herself. Her dream is to be able to have a large restaurant, which will help her improve her standard of living and that of her family. 

Maria is requesting the loan to buy flour, meat, condiments, eggs, bread, vegetables and other supplies which she will use to prepare the foods she sells. She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the opportunity she is once again receiving.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, condiments, eggs, breads, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of motor oils, motor parts, and gasoline.

loans.name: Villa Itaipu Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Villa Itaipu”, está integrado por 13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con un gran espíritu de superación y lucha diaria.
La Sra. Bella es miembro de este grupo muy unido, ella comenta que desde muy temprana edad trabaja, por lo que ya esta muy acostumbrada a luchar y trabajar por sus metas. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de todo tipo desde hace ya un tiempo, es gracias a este negocio que ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, con lo que podrá abastecerse y dar más variedad a sus clientes y a la vez poder atraer a más de ellos.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Villa Itaipu.” It is made up of 13 women from Ciudad del Este. They are very hard-working women, with a great desire to get ahead and work hard every day.

Bella is a member of this very united group. She comments that she worked starting at a very young age, and thus she is quite used to struggling and working for her goals. She dedicates herself to buying and selling clothing of all types, which she has done for some time now. It is thanks to this business that she has been able to get ahead and help her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy winter clothing, which will allow her to stock up and to offer more variety to her customers, which will in turn allow her to attract more of them.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath is 42 years old, a loving father who is married and has three children. He lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. He and his spouse have been operating a rice farming business to generate their livelihood. Aside from rice husbandry, Nath is also skillful in making furniture like chairs, cabinets, tables, and stools to produce extra income.

Nath wants to develop his business. Due to financial constraints, he is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 to purchase trees, which can be used to make furniture for sale. 

Nath is happy for the given funds to improve his business. He hopes to lift his family out of poverty through his efforts and patience.

loans.use: to purchase trees, which can be used to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Pouline

texts.en:
Pouline is 28 years old and married to Julius. They are blessed with two healthy children aged eight and four years old. For the past four years she has been running a retail shop that brings in a monthly income of KES.17,000.

Having repaid her first loan, Pouline is now requesting her second loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more bags of rice and sugar for resale. With the anticipated profits she plans to buy more sugar and rice stock and use the remaining amount to sustain her family.

Pouline hopes to make more business investments in the future and become a famous business woman in her town.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Joise

texts.en: Joise, a 26-year-old married mother of three children, has been a maize farmer for two years now, earning a monthly income of 5,000 shillings. She is now requesting her first loan with KADET LTD to buy farm inputs to improve her farming. Joise will use the profits to improve and expand her business, and in the future hopes to conduct horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will put more grocery stock at his shop to be able to fulfill his clients' needs and increase his sales and profits. 

He is very professional in his dealings and his clients come to his shop regularly because they can find their desired product easily in his shop. 

Azra is a housewife. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children. One of them studies while the remaining children stay at home. 

Azra is a very supportive lady and is very confident that the loan investment will be productive for her husband and he will be able to successfully improve his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Ndiengdiaw Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois est inauguré le 9 avril 2011, il est actuellement à son troisième cycle; il est composé de 45 femmes membres qui habitent le village et les hameaux environnants mais il faut noté que c'est seulement 41 clientes qui ont bénéficié de prêt. Les activités dominantes sont l'embouche ovine, bovine et le petit commerce.

L'emprunteur en vedette Madame Ndéye Marième est âgée de 27 ans, elle est la secrétaire du Banc Villageois; elle est mariée mère de deux filles qui ont 7 ans et 3 ans. Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine et bovine et en même temps un petit commerce de diverses marchandises. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en robe verte et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt, elle envisage d'acheter deux moutons pour une valeur de 50 000 F CFA, des marchandises variées (encens, parfums, tissus, chaussures, bijoux.....)d'un montant de 65 000 F CFA dans les marchés hebdomadaires à proximité de son village et va revendre dans sa localité et les 10 000F CFA vont lui servir de fonds de roulement. Ainsi elle compte se faire plus de revenus.

Ses bénéfices vont servir à augmenter son épargne afin d'obtenir un crédit plus élevé, soutenir ses enfants dans leur scolarité et aussi construire une maison pour eux.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created on April 9, 2011 and is on its third loan cycle.  Its comprises 45 members, all women, who live in one village and its surrounding hamlets.  It should be noted that only 41 women are taking a loan this time.  Their main activities are fattening livestock (sheep and cows) and small retail business.

The featured borrower, Ndéye Marième, is 27 years old.  She is the secretary of the Banc Villageois.  She is married and the mother of two girls, ages 7 and 3.  She is involved in fattening sheep and cows and she also has a small retail business selling various goods.  In the photo, she is the woman standing in the right corner, wearing a green dress and raising her left hand.

With her loan, she is planning to buy two sheep of a 50,000 CFA francs value and various goods (incense, perfume, fabrics, shoes, jewelry...) at a cost of 65,000 CFA francs.  She will make these purchases at the weekly markets located near her village and will resell in her locality.  She will also use 10,000 CFA francs as working capital.  In this manner, she is planning to increase her income.

Profits will be used to increase her savings in order to obtain a larger loan, to support her children's education, and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and to purchase various goods for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 24 años, es una buena mujer y trabajadora. Su pareja es Jimy, de 24 años, con quien tiene una niña de 4 años. Viven en su casa propia y todos los días trabaja mucho para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Produce yuca, tiene 1.5 hectáreas de chacra donde realiza su trabajo. Desde muy temprano se dirige al lugar, junto a su pareja, quien le ayuda en las tareas que hay que realizar en la tierra. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 7 años y durante ese tiempo aprendió muchas cosas, es así que encontró la mejor forma de sacar productos buenos, nutritivos y sobre todo de buena calidad. Le está yendo bien en su negocio, produce cada seis meses y le queda lo suficiente para seguir invirtiendo en otros productos mientras espera la siguiente cosecha.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para continuar con el mejoramiento de sus tierras. Además está convencida que será una socia responsable de su crédito. Espera pertenecer mucho tiempo a este banco comunal, ya que tiene referencias que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará abono para fertilizar sus siembras, así como lampas y otras herramientas para optimizar el tiempo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 24, is a good woman and a hard worker. Her partner is Jimy, age 24, and they have a four-year-old daughter. They live in their own home and work hard every day in order to have a better quality of life.

Hilda grows cassava on 1.5 hectares of land where she performs her work. In the early morning hours she leaves for work with her partner, who helps with the tasks required to maintain their land. Hilda has been doing this type of work for seven years and has learned many things during that time. She has discovered the best ways to attain good products that are nutritious and of good quality. Hilda is doing well in her business. She produces every six months, which is sufficient for continuing to invest in other products while she waits for the next harvest.

This is her first loan with MFP. Hilda is very pleased to know that she has financial support for continuing the improvements to her land. In addition, she is convinced that she will be a responsible member with her loan. Hilda expects to be with her Communal Bank for a long time since everyone in the group has a reputation for being responsible and supportive of one another. The amount of 1,000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy compost for fertilizing her crops. She will also buy lanterns and other tools to optimize her time at work.

loans.use: to buy compost and equipment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 37-year-old boutique owner. She is a married mother with one child. She has been running this business for the last three years with great success.

This is Agnes’ third loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers, and handbags to resell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers, and handbags

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
To support her business, Ni Luh and the Sari Wangi Ternak group decided to take out another loan with a higher loan amount.  They will use the loan to help buy piglets and feed, and to renovate the barn.  

Ni Luh will use the loan only to purchase piglets, preferably sows.  She purchased the feed using the profit from the last loan.  With 1.5M IDR of the loan, she can purchase three superior piglets.  Beside superior piglets, she also has local pigs for pig rolls.  She hopes the pigs can grow healthy and she can sell them at a high price.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Delia works hard to support her family.  

She has an ambulant vending business selling dried fish and eggs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling of fruits.  Delia is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock to sell from her fish and egg business.  

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Haraya

texts.en:
Haraya is 24 years old and married with 2 children.

Haraya works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Haraya has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Haraya aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in the store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, soap, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, egg, etc.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Deova

texts.en:
Deova is 26 years old and single with three children.  With two children in school, Deova works very hard to provide for them.  

Deova runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.  

Deova has been in this business for two years.  

In the future Deova would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 44 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 28, 26 and 16.  She has been farming for the last three years, and earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).  

She has requested a third loan of 15,000 KES to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.  The anticipated profit will help her educate her children and continue with farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 56 years old, married, and has three children.  

Glenda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks to sell.  

Glenda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the charcoal retail business for three years and also earns an income from a general store.  

Glenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.
