Marilou has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruit.

Marilou aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and has 8 children. She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase farm supplies.

Marilyn has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has previously borrowed 10 times from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grain business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grain to sell for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for 8 years. Marissa earns further income from rice retailing.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money in order to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva works hard to support her family. Neva is married and has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines.

Neva requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Neva has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Neva would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock to sell

loans.name: Dioral Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis sa création en octobre 2010.

Il est composé de femmes habitants du même village et pratiquant toutes La même activité  la vente de 

céréales et de poissons. Les membres de ce banc villageois entretiennent de bonnes relations de voisinages depuis longtemps .

Madame Gnilane est une femme mariée âgée  de 63 ans et mère de 8 enfants. Son activité principale se trouve être le commerce de mil d’arachide.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 3 sacs de mil de 50 kg; et 2 sacs d’arachides de 50 kg 

qu'elle va revendre au détails à ses clients au niveau de son village .

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine . Les bénéfices de son activité  lui permettent d’assurer 

la dépense quotidienne et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence since its creation in 2010.  It consists of women who live in the same village and who are all involved in such retail activities as selling grains and fish.  The members of this Banc Villageois have been enjoying good neighbors' relationships for a long time.

Gnilane is a 63-year-old married woman and the mother of 8 children.  Her main activity is selling millet and groundnut.

With her new loan, she is planning to buy three 50 kilo sacks of millet, and two 50 kilo sacks of groundnut.  She will retail her goods to her customers in her village. 

Gnilane has a good experience in this field.  Profits from her business help her to cover day-to-day expenses and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and millet.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 34 years old and married with 3 children.

Rodelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rodelyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rodelyn aspires to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various foods such as tomatoes, cassava, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Roberto Antonio de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, y tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que ha adquirido mucha experiencia a la hora de la siembra; es muy buen comerciante se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque vende producto de calidad, a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Roberto es un hombre trabajador, entregado a sus ideales, siempre está buscando el mejor camino para salir adelante, en su última cosecha no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas, no pudo vender todo porque perdió buena parte de la siembra debido a un fenómeno climático, en este periodo quiere recuperarse y cultivará una manzana de terreno de maiz, pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante y abonos. Roberto Antonio no tiene experiencia crediticia, pero tiene buenas referencias de ser muy responsable, está seguro que con el trabajo realizado podrá saldar el financiamiento, además tiene fe que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Roberto Antonio, 52, lives with his life partner and their children.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn.  He already has a lot of experience as a farmer, and he is also a good seller.  He has a lot of customers because he sells quality products at reasonable prices, and his service is excellent.  Roberto is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his ideals and is always seeking a better path to get ahead.  In his last harvest, he did not get the earnings he hoped for.  He was not able to sell all of his crops, because he lost some of them due the weather.  At this time, he wants to recover so he will plant a plot of land with corn.  However, he needs to invest in supplies, and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and manure.  Roberto Antonio does not have a credit history, but he has good references characterizing him as a very responsible person.  He is sure that with this work, he will be able to pay off this loan.  Also, he has faith that he will be able to provide his family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este. Ellas son jefas de familia, que se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras, ya que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio han podido ir progresando y actualmente están en el octavo ciclo.
Julia es una de las miembros, ella es la presidenta del grupo y comenta que con mucho esfuerzo siempre ayuda a sus amigas a que tengan ganas de seguir luchando y progresando. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Esta vez solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con prendas para este frio, ya que quiere estar bien surtida y de esa forma darle una buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación, ya que por medio de su programa, las miembros han podido mejorar mucho sus vidas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Renacer" is made up of 13 women from Ciudad del Este.  They are heads of households, and they got together with the idea of helping each other, because they saw a great opportunity with the Program of Enterprising Women in the Fundación Paraguaya.  Thanks to their efforts and sacrifice, they have been able to make progress, and they are currently in their 8th loan cycle.

Julia is one of the members.  She is the president of the group, and she says that she puts a lot of effort into helping her friends who have a desire to continue to strive to make progress.  She has a business selling all types of garments, and thanks to this, she has been able to get ahead and help her family.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to stock up with garments for the upcoming winter, because she wants to be well-stocked so that she can offer a good variety of products to her customers.  She thanks the Fundacion, because through this program, her group has been able to improve their lives a lot.

loans.use: to buy winter garments to sell

loans.name: Malikajon

texts.ru: Маликачон жительница города Вахдат. Ей 49 лет. Она разведена. У нее две детей. Она занимается торговлей детской мебели и колясок. Кредит берет для покупки детских кроваток и ходунков.
texts.en: Malikajon lives in Vahdat city.  She is 49 years old.  She is divorced.  She has two children.  She sells children's furniture and strollers.  She is taking out a loan to buy cribs and baby walkers.

loans.use: to buy cribs and baby walkers

loans.name: Ndiogolor Saseme Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 14 Octobre 2010 date d'ouverture du Banc villageois.

Il est composé des femmes qui habitent le même village et s'activent en majorité dans le commerce de fruits et 

d’arachide et de mil.

Les membres de ce banc villageois entretiennent de bonnes relations sociales depuis longtemps.

Madame Fatou est veuve âgée de 62 ans  et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 filles et 5 garçons.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de fruits locaux ,du mil et de l'arachide..

Avec son nouveau crédit de 120000 elle va des fruits de l'huile de palme ,de l'arachide et du mil qu'elle va 

revendre au détails dans son village et aux marchés environnants.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et assurer la 

dépenses quotidienne.
texts.en: This group has been created on October 14, 2010, the day the Banc Villageois opened. The group is composed of women who live in the same village and mostly sell fruits, peanuts, and millet. The members of this Banc Villageois have maintained good social connections for a long time. Mrs. Fatou is a widow. She is 62 years old and the mother of 10 children, five daughters and five sons. She sells local fruits, millet and peanut. With her new loan of 120,000 West African francs, she will [buy] fruits, palm oil, peanuts and millet to retail in her village and at the nearby markets. The income derived from this business allows her to pay for the children’s education and provide for everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and palm oil.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 36-year-old married man with five children. Three of his children are in school. 

He operates a retail shop selling daily household items in the outskirts of Lyantonde town and works seven days a week. He started the shop so that he could earn an income to meet the needs of his family. 

He wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to buy more stock for the retail shop. He does part-time teaching in one of the village schools to supplement his income. He hopes that his shop will expand in the near future so that he does not have to keep borrowing. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Ndoundokh Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe qui a été crée en octobre 2010 est composé de femmes qui habitent le même village et pratiquent toutes le petit commerce et l'élevage  porcine.
 les membres de ce groupe sont unis par des liens sociaux qui datent  de longtemps.

Aissatou est une femme marié ag"e de 29 ans et mère de deux filles de 9 ans et de 3 ans et un garçon  de 5 ans .
elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son inauguration. elle pratique le commerce de porc , de l'huile de palme,et de la restauration ( vente de petit déjeuner)
son nouveau crédit de 85000  lui permettra de se payer 2 porcelets; 20litre d'huile de palme des spaghettis et des condiments .

les bénéfice générés par son activité lui permettront d'acheter des vêtements et accessoires pour ses enfants mais également de diversifier son activité .
texts.en:
This group, created in October 2010, is composed of women living in the same village. They all have retail businesses and raise pigs. The group members are connected through long-standing social ties. 

Aissatou is a 29-year old married woman. She is the mother of two girls, nine and three years of age, and a 5-year old boy. Aissatou has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” since its inauguration. She sells pork, palm oil and cooked food (breakfast dishes). Her new loan of 85,000 West African francs will allow her to buy two piglets, 20 liters of palm oil, spaghetti and condiments. The income derived from her business will allow her to buy clothing and accessories for her children as well as to diversify her offerings.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, 20 liters of palm oil, spaghetti and condiments.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 32 года. У него двое детей. Он более пяти лет занимается ремонтом ювелирных изделий. Кредит берет для покупки золота и крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Muhiddin lives in Vahdat city.  He is married.  He is 32 years old.  He has two children.  For more then two years he has been repairing jewelry.  He is taking out a loan to purchase gold and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase gold and livestock

loans.name: Swaibu

texts.en:
Swaibu is a married man who is 36 years old. He has four children of school-going age between 11 and 4 years old. They all attend nearby schools. 

He runs a retail shop in one of the city surburbs and sells mainly cosmetics. He began the cosmetics shop in 2007 because ladies are the biggest consumers, especially when it comes to beauty products. Therefore, he couldn't go wrong. He has been able to pay school fees and support his family with the income from the shop. He hopes to become an agent for Movit, a jelly and cosmetics processing factory in the city.

He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Iso

texts.ru: Исо хитель города Вахдат. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается торговлей. Исо в основном занимается продажей топлива и природного газа. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Iso is a resident of Vahdat city.  He is 46 years old.  He is married.  He has three children.  He is a trader.  Iso mostly sells fuel and natural gas.  He has been working in this sphere for two years.  He is taking out a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and gasoline

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 59, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Amador, a businessman, and is mother to their five children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Myrna operates a variety store and water station. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Myrna earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and to purchase some necessities for her water station. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myrna hopes to be able to expand soon, and be able to settle all her financial obligations. She also hopes to have an out-of-town vacation with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 24 years old and is married. She owns a sewing business and has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 7 am to 6 pm. 

Christine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more machines for sewing. With any profits she makes, she will be able to save for her future, she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more machines for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en: Khon and her husband live in a wooden house located in Dambae district. They have been farming rice and growing cassava, a kind of crop that is commonly grown in her area, for 10 years to support the family. Khon is 45 years old and has four children, all still living with the family. Some of her children are paid workers and some work at the plantation. One constraint of her business is the cassava's price dropped. Khon has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and after successfully paying off all these loans, she applied for a fifth loan while her group members applied for their first and second loans. Khon used her income to buy household equipment for her family. With the current loan from VisionFund, Khon will use her portion to cultivate her plantation and buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income and therefore expand her business and feed her family better.

loans.use: to cultivate her farmland and buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has seven children who are between 4 and 17 years old. In addition, she looks after her two nephews who are orphans.
 
Flavia has done agriculture since 2000.  She sells coffee seedlings and bananas. From this, she has managed to purchase a piece of land and build a permanent house.  The seedlings are mainly bought by farmers.
 
She wants UGX 3,000,000 to buy improved seeds and construct a sheltered structure to prevent the seeds from scorching. She also wants to complete furnishing her house.

She dreams of being a model farmer in her subcounty in the future. Her main challenge is inadequate capital to purchase better quality seeds.

Flavia is a very hard-working and enterprising lady.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and build a shelter for them

loans.name: Shahlar

texts.en: Shahlar, 19, studies at Azerbaijan Technology University. He began studying in 2011 and expects to finish in 2015. He is studying the technology of manufacturing products. His parents are working and pay for his education. However, last year it become harder because of some family problems. Shahlar applied for 1700 AZN loan to pay two years of his education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fee.

loans.name: Montagne  Sud Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Montagne Sud est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008.Le groupe PC 02 est composé de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme principales activités l'élevage et le commerce.

La responsable madame Ndéye est âgée de 30 ans; elle est mariée mère de deux garçons qui ont 5 et 3 ans. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits cosmétiques dans son quartier, elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 2 ans.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite avec un châle vert autour des épaules et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achète ses produits (parfums, lait corporel, encens....) auprès d'un grand commerçant de la place au marché central de la ville et revend dans son quartier.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter 20 paquets de parfums, 20 caisses de lait de corps et des bocaux d'encens afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.
Elle compte avec ses bénéfices développer son épargne afin d'accéder un jour au prêt spécial et plus tard au prêt initiation à la petite entreprise.
texts.en:
The “Banc Villageois of Montagne Sud” has been created on March 28, 2008. The PC 02 group is composed of 18 women living in the same neighborhood and working mainly as vendors and livestock farmers.

The group’s leader, Mrs. Ndéye, is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of two boys, five and three years of age. She retails cosmetic products in her neighborhood. She has sufficient experience with this work, over two years. On the photo she is standing on the right, with a green shawl around her shoulders, and raising her left hand.

She buys her goods (perfume, body milk, incense etc) from a mass merchant at the central market of her town, and resells in her neighborhood.
She would like to use her loan to buy 20 packs of perfume, 20 cases of body milk and some jars of incense in order to earn good revenues. She plans to use her income to bolster her savings in order to obtain a special loan one day and,  eventually, a loan to launch a small business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products intended for resale.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Natiq, 22, studies at Azerbaijan Technology University. He entered this university in 2009 and is studying standardizing and technology machines. He is going to complete his studies in 2013. He is not working, even part time, because it is impossible due to the number of lessons and study hours. His parents pay for his education. Life is more expensive every year and to pay his education fee Natiq applied for a loan of 1400 AZN. This will help to pay tuition in advance and complete his studies successfully.

loans.use: to pay last two year`s tuition.

loans.name: Abdurahman

texts.en: Abdurahman, 20, is a student at Azerbaijan Technology University. He entered university in 2009 and will complete studies in 2013. He is in the third year of studying food product technology and tourism. His dream is to travel a lot after graduating. Abdurahman is not working and his parents pay his education fees.  Now he needs to pay for his last two years and for this purpose applied for a loan of 2000 AZN.

loans.use: to pay university fee.

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is 20 and attends Azerbaijan Technology University.  He studies food product technology and tourism. He is a third-year student who began studies in 2010 and will complete them in 2014. He studies very well and always gets A grades. Farid`s father is the only one working in the family and it has become harder to cover family needs after another child in their family entered university.  Now expenses doubled and to cover tuition, Farid has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib is a 21-year-old man who studies at the Azerbaijan Technology University. He has been studying in the Faculty of Standardizing and Technological Machines since 2009. Now in the third year of his course, he wishes to work in a machine factory abroad after finishing university. Sahib's parents pay his education fees. Now they have applied for a 2000 AZN loan to pay for the last two years of his tuition.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fee

loans.name: Turqut

texts.en: Turqut is a 20-year-old man who studies at the Azerbaijan Technology University. He has been doing a course in the Faculty of Technology of Manufacturing Products and Expertise since 2009. Turqut lives with his family and they have been paying his tuition fees. Turqut is now in the third year of university and he wishes to start work right after he completes his course.  He has applied for 1100 AZN to pay for his third and fourth year tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for the last two years of his university fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Maria es modista, trabaja en una pieza de madera que construyo en el fondo de su hogar. Aunque su taller es un poco precario es su medio de ingresos y la forma con la que ayuda a su familia.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo y eso le ayuda y le viene muy bien.
Maria solicita el crédito para la refacción de su taller, ya que eso le permitirá trabajar mucho mejor y rendir al doble por las mejorías de su local. Y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella agradece por la ayuda, ya que es una gran oportunidad para ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a modest hard working woman. She works in a room made out of wood, in the back of her home. Even though her shop is a little bit precarious, it is the way she makes money to help her family. 

She is very hard working and has an entrepreneurial spirit. She told us that she always has a lot of work, which helps her, and that her business is doing well. She has requested a loan to make a few repairs to her work space. This will allow her to work much better, producing twice as much, thanks to the improvements to her work space. In this way she will increase her income and be able to give a better quality of life to her children. She is thankful for the help and believes that it is a great opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to make repairs to her sewing shop.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria tiene 56 años de edad, y habita junto a sus hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de  variedad de ropa para todos los gustos preferencias. La actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas de la ciudad como en  mercados y plazas. Vende variedad de prendas de vestir a precios accesibles para todas las personas. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo muy positiva. Su deseo es poder comprar variedad de prendas de vestir para surtir su negocio, con el fin de mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos que le permitan continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar. Esta es la razón por la cual se decidió en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL dado que no cuenta con los fondos propios para hacer la inversión en la compra de prendas de vestir como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, shorts, etc. Tiene plena confianza que con la ayuda de esta institución, logrará su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Gloria is 56 years old and lives with her children. She makes a living selling a variety of clothing, for all types of styles. She sells by walking around in main areas of the city, like markets and town squares. She sells a variety of types of clothing at reasonable prices for everyone. She is known for being hard working, responsible, honest and above all positive. She wants to be able to buy a variety of pieces of clothing to restock her business, with the goal of increasing her sales and profits, which allow her to keep providing for her household. This is the reason that she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL, since she does not have the funds herself to be able to make an investment in her business to buy clothing like: skirts, blouses, pants, under garments, shorts, etc. She is confident that with the help of this institution, she will reach her goal of improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, under garments, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Sokchheng

texts.en: Sokchheng is 34 years old and married with one boy and one girl who are both still in school. To make a living, Sokchheng and her husband do rice farming and grow cassava. Her family makes less than 10 US dollar per day on average. Sokchheng has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already and now she is requesting another loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings and to spend on land preparation. The previous loans from VisionFund have helped to feed her family better and pay her children's school fees. She hopes the requested loan will enable her to make more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: San Francisco 2 Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Francisco 2 es de la ciudad de Pilar, está empezando a trabajar como grupo, se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con gran entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familiares. Ellas tienen mucha esperanza en que este programa les ayudara a poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas.
La Sra. Zulma se dedica a la venta de mazamorra y pescados y nos comenta que mediante el arduo trabajo que hace, puede mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.  Ella cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio bien amplio donde poder ofrecer sus productos y también dar buena comodidad a sus clientes y tener más espacio para poder tener más productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, con lo que tendrá más en stock y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda y pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank group 'San Francisco 2' is in the city of Pilar, and are beginning to work as a group. They are in their first loan cycle, with great enthusiasm and desire to get ahead, and in this way be able to help their families. The woman have a lot of hope that this program will help them be able to grow, not just economically, but also as people. 

Zulma makes a living selling 'mazamorra', a traditional sweet corn pudding, and fish. She told us that as a result of her hard work, she is able to provide for her family and give them what they need day to day. She said that her dream is to have a large business where she can offer her products and also provide her customers with a comfort place and also have more space where she can have more products. She has requested a loan to buy fish, which will increase her stock and allow her to be able to meet the demands and orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Apophia

texts.en:
Apophia is 27 years old and is single. She owns a beauty salon and has been in this business for one year. Her salon is open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day of the week, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Apophia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her beauty salon business by buying more equipment, such as chairs, machines and combs to use in the business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her beauty salon business by buying more equipment, such as chairs, machines and combs

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Kuña Katupyry” está en el primer ciclo, son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de sus propios esfuerzos. Son muy unidas y tratan de hacer trabajos juntas para que de esa forma puedan pasar cualquier problema que puedan tener.
Gladys es cantinera, y comenta que trabaja arduamente, se levanta todos los días desde muy tempranas horas para empezar a trabajar y vuelve muy tarde a su casa. Ella lucha por su familia, ya que quiere darles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones no limitaciones. Su meta es poder tener una gran despensa y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos y ser una gran microempresaria.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de jugos, gaseosas, galletitas, golosinas y demás insumos para poder surtir su cantina y de esa forma seguir generando ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group of women “Kuña Katupyry” are in their first loan cycle. They are women who have a strong desire to get ahead and help their families through their own efforts. They are a very united group and they try to work together so that they can overcome any problem that may come along. 

Gladys makes a living by running a small store. She told us that she works hard, waking up early every morning to begin working and returning to her house very late. She works hard for her family because she wants to be able to give to them what they need, without depriving them of anything. Her goal is to have a large store, and in this way improve her income and become a great small businesswoman. She has requested a loan to buy juices, sodas, cookies, snacks, and other supplies to be able to restock her store. This will allow her to continue making a profit and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, cookies, snacks and other supplies.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is 28 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. He has no kids yet. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and carving. He has been in this business for six years. The main challenge for him is the lack of working capital for his business. With his current business, he manages to earn a daily income of around 47,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Chi with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. To cope with the challenge, he is requesting a loan with VisionFund of US $750. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seed for his rice farming business and some materials for his carving business. He hopes to increase his family's income to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Hoeuy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Moung Russey district, Hoeuy is a 55-year-old mother of seven children: six daughters and one son. Out of her seven children, she has one child who is still school. She earns a living through farming rainy-season rice to support her big family. She has been in this primary business for more than 10 years. 

Hoeuy has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for four loan cycles already while the other members in the group have been with VisionFund for three to four cycles. She successfully repaid the prior loans, which has enabled her to support her family better. With her current business, she can earn around 18,000 KHR per day. With the need to support her business, she is leading her group of five female members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation. She hopes this loan will help her business prosper and she hopes to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of two children, Yim is a rural farmer living in the area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She has been farming her five-hectare farmland for more than 10 years to make a living and she supplements her income by providing plowing and water pumping service for pay. Her main challenge to the business is flooding, which has spoiled her crop.

Yim has been with VisionFund for several loan cycles and completely paid back the loans, which has helped her to support her businessl. With her current business, she manages to earn around 72,000 KHR per day to support her family. With the need to support her business, she is requesting another loan with VisionFund of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and gasoline for her water pump. She hopes to grow healthy rice and have more crop yields to make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and gasoline for her water pump

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Miguel” es un comité de 16 mujeres, están muy bien consolidadas. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen siempre para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a otras en su afán de mejorar sus vidas.
Maria forma parte de este trabajador grupo, y ella dice que se dedica a la lavandería, lava prendas de todo tipo. Gracias al buen trabajo que siempre hace ya tiene una buena clientela, cada vez en mayor crecimiento. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener una gran lavandería con muchas maquinas, y de esa forma poder también ayudar a las demás personas, dándoles puestos de trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones en polvo, enjuagues para ropas, suavizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le acercan sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Miguel” group is made up of 16 women, who are very well established. These women are from the city of Villarrica, and are all neighbors and friends. They always meet to offer one another support and help, in their desire to improve their lives.

Maria is part of this hard-working group, and says that she has a laundry and washes clothing articles of every kind. Thanks to the good work she always does, she already has a good clientele that grows more and more. One of her dreams is to have a large laundry with many machines, and that way be able to also help other people, by providing them jobs.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy soap powders, clothing rinses, softeners and other supplies, enabling her to continue working and filling the orders that her customers bring to her.

loans.use: To buy soap powders, clothing rinses, softeners and other supplies.

loans.name: Kimhouy

texts.en:
Kimhouy is 32 years old and divorced. She lives with her daughter in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a primary source of income for the villagers. Her dependent daughter is still in school. She has been farming rice to make a living for seven years and she supplements her income by working as a paid construction worker. With her current business, she earns a daily income of around 21,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses. 

This is Kimhouy's first loan with VisionFund. With the need to finish her house, she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use this loan to pay for materials to finish building her house. This loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in, especially for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish her house building

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Ratanak Mondul district, Chamroeun is 50 years old and married. She is a mother of three children who are dependent on her and still in school. The sources of her family's income are from their seven-hectare maize plantation, one hectare of sesame seeds and one hectare of beans. She has been in these businesses for several years. The main challenges for her businesses are insects and low yields. 

Chamroeun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have significantly helped her make a better living.  With a good business, she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy crop seeds and to spend a portion of it for labor. She hopes to earn a larger income from the businesses and extend her farmland.

loans.use: To buy crop seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
Chamroeun is 33 years old and lives in a rural village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Cambodia. He has three sons who are still in school and dependent on him. To make a living, he has been farming red maize on a five-hectare farm for several years. He has another source of income from his grocery business. The main challenge for him is the lack of working capital to support his family's business in a timely manner.

Chamroeun's group consists of four members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. He completely paid back his loan. The prior loan helped him make a better living. To cope with the challenges, he is leading his group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm and pay for land preparation. He hopes to increase his crop yields so he can afford to extend his farmland and repair his house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old, single and the mother of two children who are four and 15 years old. She runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of 55,000 Kenya shillings. She gets additional income as a teacher.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy stock of sugar, maize flour, rice, soaps and other merchandise for her shop.

Her dream is to expand her business to be a good source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase  more sugar, maize flour, rice, soaps and other merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Youleat's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in an area in the Dambae district, Youleat is 29 years old and married with two sons who are still dependent on her and in school. Like most of the villagers, rice farming and cassava plantation are her family's sources of income. She has been farming cassava on one hectare of farmland and rice on three hectares of  farmland for several years to support the family. The main challenge for her family's business is the drop in the price of cassava, which has affected her living conditions.

Youleat's group consists of four members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to four cycles. With her current business, she can earn around 18,000 KHR per day. Now requesting a loan with other members, Youleat is the leader and will use her portion to buy seeds, seedling and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more good quality crops and sell them for good prices to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedling and fertilizer
